Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: LothianPinklady
Reviews.Content: Super service where you made to feel welcome from the moment you arrive.Help was always on hand if required and the service was always with a smile. Pool area and gym facilties excellent and open for long hours which is heads up on some accomodation we've stayed in. We were there on a room only basis and we did get caught out by a rather expensive breakfast ($90+) on our first morning! If you're on a budget, watch out. Otherwise, had a super time.

Reviews.Title: “As good as you get”
Reviews.Author: IrelandHardy
Reviews.Content: Apart from having a small and often shaded pool area, I cannot find any aspect of this hotel about which to make an adverse comment. We encountered courteous, efficient, friendly and unobtrusive service in all areas of the hotel from concierge, lobby, bar and restaurant and [in spite of earlier comment about limited pool facilities], especially at the pool and gym areas. The extensive lounges enable business and family groups to meet and talk in comfort: bedrooms are a good size, comfortable and well maintained on a daily basis. After 10 years of making annual visits to Sing, I think I have found the hotel base for future years.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: mimroe
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay at the regent we had a very reasonably priced suite with access to the excellent club with breakfast and snacks included our room was spacious and clean but most importantly quiet comfortable bed could have done with some furniture on the balcony Concierge service was excellent as was our check in and the staff at the club were very friendly and helpful as were the pool attendants whilst the pool wasn't large the cold water ice tea fruit and cold towels were a lovely touch location is perfect for orchard road Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best service”
Reviews.Author: mclouka
Reviews.Content: We booked the room through the hotel web and there was a confusion of whether our suite was club or executive and breakfast and wifi were included in the price or not. So be careful while you book because the info is misleading and there is nothing you can do when you arrive. We talked with the manager and he was not helpful at all. Beside that incident, the service at the hotel was top marks. Twice room cleaning daily, really good pampering at the pool with free nibbles every half an hour. Great location if you love shopping, helpful staff at the reception, amazing flower arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “The Regent hotel did not care for customer from internet booking agent.”
Reviews.Author: sopapanr
Reviews.Content: I did internet booking through agoda.com for room of 3 persons, specified non smoking, high floor, away from elevator,foam pillow.. I al so sent 2 emails to the hotel before departure for my request confirmation and got the reply. Upon arrival at 13.00 after leaving home at 04.00 am., the room assigned was the opposite,full of smoking odor and the extra bed was wrinkled like somebody already slept on it., the room was on 6 th. floor of the 12 floor hotel! When I complained(actually yelling our of frustration)the reception robotic staffs could do nothing until the British duty manager came to settle, moved me to another floor room, 7 th, which was truly non smoking odor and I asked him to smell the difference. Still the room condition was no better, the electric kettle was not working and we had to struggle with its plug early morning, The sink drainage was clogged and has bad odor in the morning after the door was closed all night. We left the room the next morning and came back at 6 pm.to find the room unmade. The house keeper said the DND was on! It was the switch next to the light switch at the door which we closed it upon departure with good intention to save electricity like we do at home when we left the. That switch had no sign of what it was(same as the volume button in the bathroom which we learned that it was TV volume, in the toilet?). Clearly the hotel needs to communicate more to its customer by putting a sign sticker since there was no directory direction aside the TV channel. The only good thing in this hotel was the helpful ,, eager concierge . I stayed at this hotel a few years ago on business trip, accommodation arranged by the embassy and received wonderful treatment, with lady guided me to my room and the room with nice view so I chose to come back, to different experiences, learning that booking through internet you are nobody and get the worse hotel room they have. No more internet booking EVER. And our impression about Singapore changed, by its lifeless, no service minded ,even the sales person who did not eager to respond to our request. My family will never return to this country again for sure,

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: GeraldineSydney
Reviews.Content: I was sick as a dog whilst staying at The Regent Singapore and the concierge and team sent up a bowl of soup, orange juice and a card signed by 12 front office staff!! Kudos to a wonderful caring team at The Regent - it's gestures like this that exemplifies great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rafael1_toribio41
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and accommodating, the hotel looks old but it still has its luxurious charm, with its well decorated lobby. The rooms were beautiful and elegant, with various features that make our stay more pleasurable. The hotel is very accessible, there is even a bus stop dedicated to it, situated right in front of it (we took the bus and MRT most of the time because we had a SMRT Tourist Pass). Also the items sold at the patisserie were of reasonable price. This is what we paid for, and we got something even beyond what we expected. Truly a magnificent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: DJ62
Reviews.Content: Very efficient check in/out and beautiful club room, spacious and spotless with complimentary water. Worth the additional cost of the club side as we enjoyed early evening snacks and drinks on the terrace outside. Close to Orchard road and the Botanical gardens. Found the concierge very helpful in recommending a late night eating venue after our arrival. Absolutely no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: edwardaberg
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to compliment the staff of The Regent Singapore. They were all friendly and very eager to please; they made the stay as pleasant as possible. Having said that, this hotel is old and in dire need of refurbishment. This Regent does not in any way reflect Regent properties I've stayed at in other parts of the world, and the fact that it's somehow attached to the 4 Seasons brand, absolutely confounds me. We stayed in a suite on the Regency level and the room carpet and furnishings were tired and scarce, with a very small bathroom. The Regency Club had visibly soiled sofas which to my estimation was inexcusable for a hotel that claims such a high pedigree. The deck off the Regency Club had tattered furniture that was dirty and not welcoming whatsoever. There was no deck furniture at all on either deck of our suite; again, unforgivable with The Regent and 4 Seasons names attached. This hotel is closer to a Holiday Inn than it is a Regent, and bears no comparison to any 4 Seasons I've been to. I had Easter Brunch at The 4 Seasons Hotel in Singapore, and the comparison to The Regent couldn't have been more stark. In short, I would not return to this Regent, and would suggest looking elsewhere if you want first class deluxe accommodations, because this hotel fails on all parts other than its great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room in a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: runsandjumps
Reviews.Content: What a grande dame this hotel is. Beautiful architecture, gorgeous staircases and public areas. If the hotel is dated, it's to an era of grandeur and if it's refurbished to the standard of modern boutique hotels then much will be lost and mourned. From the marbled bathrooms with the deep wide bat to the treasures on display in the lobby and the fantastic cabinets and coffee tables in the rooms this is an experience that those of us who don't live in palaces can only enjoy in a hotel like this one. What a shame then that our room was so noisy. We wanted to book the standard room which at the time of booking was available but we were 'upgraded' and paid more for the deluxe room. When we saw the construction site opposite I tried to downgrade (at the same rate) but was told it wasn't available. As we were stopping over for a single night between flights the last thing we needed was noise and unhelpful staff but that"s what we got. A wander round the beautiful public areas after an excellent breakfast helped to improve things, as did Joseph, the type of doorman that only a hotel like this would have - remembering faces, names, friendly but not crossing any boundaries. I"d love to stay again when we next pass through singapore, but only if I can be assured we'd be nowhere near the construction site.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: anusenvy
Reviews.Content: Service in this hotel was impeccable, from the minute we stepped out of our cab. Our check in was quick and effortless. We were given a twin room (for three people) on the 7th floor. The room was spacious and spotless! The welcome drinks and popcorn were appreciated. The free bottles of water during the turndown service was good, too. We never ran out of toiletries or choice of hot drinks! The free wifi iwas useful for us, too. The breakfast was great - excellent, tasty food and again, very good service by the staff. Even when it was really busy, we were taken care of. There were so many choose from that it catered for all our tastes. Their desserts are very yummy! The staff at their to go store were so sweet, they gave us a discount! The quality of service and their food set this hotel apart from the rest. It may be an old design (bdefinitely not shabby) building but it still looks great! And they will really take care of you here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: Dekari
Reviews.Content: I booked The Regent Hotel well in advance taking advantage of the better value available in their advance purchase offer. My main reason for booking this hotel was its central location and the fact that they provided a bed for my child. A lot of hotels in Singapore have no capacity for extra beds in the rooms. An added bonus was that there was no extra charge for the bed for my daughter. On checking in we were pleasantly surprised when the receptionist gave our daughter a cuddly toy. She was delighted with it and it was the start of a great stay in the Regent Hotel. On going to our room we found that all the tables, desks etc had been fitted with plastic corner protectors. This is something which I have never seen before and it certainly impressed me. To crown it all off there was even a child's bathrobe for my daughter to wear. The Regent and their staff treat their younger guests very well. The room was very spacious even with the extra bed and extremely comfortable. The bathroom was stocked with L'Occitane toiletries much to my wife's delight. The mini bar had a good selection of items but we did not use it as Singapore prices are quite prohibitive for these types of goods. We ate in the hotel on our arrival in Basilico Restaurant and it was delicious. We had an assortment of pizzas and service was prompt and efficient. Some travelers have said the hotel is dated maybe it is. However it is just the decor that is. The place is extremely clean and well maintained throughout. I would go as far as to say the hotel has a luxury feel to it. The staff are what make the hotel. Everyone we met was friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome. My only gripe and it is a small one is the $15 charge for internet per day. A hotel of this quality should in my opinion be providing free wifi in all rooms. All in all we loved The Regent and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and good location”
Reviews.Author: thomoto
Reviews.Content: The Regent is ideally situated for our needs, just minutes from Tanglin Mall, which is a nice place to shop, and a short walk from Orchard Road with all its buzz. It's also not too far from the hotel to Singapore Botanic Gardens, arguably the best place to walk in the city. The Regent is well kept and the staff welcoming and efficient, suggesting a management that values the importance of guest care. The breakfast is fantastic, and the only gripe I have about the hotel is, like most hotel breakfasts worldwide, the coffee served is mediocre at best. I would rather pay extra to have one or two cups of first rate coffee than get large quantities of free dark coloured water. Coffee aside, we'll stay at the Regent on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, in need of remodel”
Reviews.Author: BPreston310
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with a great location. You are very close to Orchard Road and MRT service. Arriving late at Changi, I took a cab from the airport for around $25SGD. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was very pleasant and professional. I give them extra points for this since my arrival was around 0200 hours. Lobby was very clean and impressive. Entered my room and found it very clean and the famous Singaporean AC keeping the room ice cold. Television was a newer model flat-screen with access to HBO and numerous western and global channels. Ordered room service and it was promptly delivered and quite good. No one arrived to retrieve the room service cart. In fact, the cart sat outside my room for the better part of the next day. One of my personal pet peeves. The room was clean although it need of an upgrade. I found the shower was difficult to operate. Took quite of bit of adjusting to get the right temp, but a non-issue considering they had great water pressure. The room had free Wi-Fi (always a bonus), but it was REALLY slow. A simple movie download would take days. I elected to upgrade to the higher speed, which really helped. I would like to see that higher speed included with the free package. Or, just add extra cost to the room. I just hate all the fees and extras. Check out very efficient and professional as was the bell staff. Overall, a great choice for location and value. There is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Plus, plus”
Reviews.Author: possalot
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business and pleasure. My wife and I stayed for 6 nights on the 7th floor. The service, food and facilities are very good. The bar has a pool table and happy hour half price drinks! The gym has free weights/universal, newspaper, coffee machine and excellent shower area. Good for the final shower if you are checking out late afternoon for flight home. Breakfast buffet good value if your hungry. Smoked salmon and cooks on hand for cooking eggs and so on. Entrance heaps of seating and private areas for business conversation. Poximity to Orchard Road shops and restaurants is a real draw card. No free wi-fi except on the 11th floor which is an additional 135SD ++ on standard rate. Go down the street to Coffee Bean they make a great coffee (better than Starbucks next door) and free wi-fi. Singapore is all about the price ++

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at The Regent”
Reviews.Author: deela27
Reviews.Content: This is my first time stayed at The Regent Hotel. i'm defnitely in love with Regent. Staff are very accomodating, rooms are spacious, and the hotel is locacted just a few steps away from Orchard Road. No exceptions for Regent :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, very good service”
Reviews.Author: EJF212
Reviews.Content: The room was a decent size and comfortably furnished. I was concerned at first that mine looked out over a building site, but it didn't cause any disturbance from my highish floor. The choice at breakfast was very good and was included in my room rate. The reservation and front desk staff were endlessly flexible with continual changes to my reservation caused by airline problems. I liked that the fitness centre was available 24 hours a day and that I was able to access it in the early evening after a morning check-out to freshen up before a long flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious Regent”
Reviews.Author: Senoko
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here around 5 times on business and never been disappointed. The staff are so attentive an accomodating. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and entirely functional for my needs. I had a car during my stay and found the underground car park really handy. The Concierge and Porters knew my name and interacted with me on a personal basis each time I appeared - nice touch. I stayed in a Regent Club Room and enjoyed the business facilities that went with it - free bar between 5.30 & 8. Well done to Bianca in the Bar (drop dead gorgeous) but I do miss Lulu (sic). Well done Regent I miss you already

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graeme T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regent during a business trip which coincided with the SIngapore GP in 2011 (pure coincidence!) Whilst the hotel was busier than previous stays the staff were as attentive as ever and the hotel lived up to its quality reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: aahtoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and the breakfast was great. There was some construction outside which was a bit noisy but bearable seeing we wanted to wake up and go do stuff during the day. I got a great deal at a website called Yeego.com

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Beats It”
Reviews.Author: Devious_Bubble_88
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel quite a number of times now. The first time was back in 2009 a few days before the Singapore GP. I actually thought it was the four seasons at first, and then realized the mistake. On first sights, the outside of the hotel looks basic and run down, however it has a beautiful lobby. The hallways to the rooms are nothing special but once inside, it has everything you would need for a more than comfortable stay. The basic rooms are spacious, VERY CLEAN and well kept. Being the F1 weekend, we decided to extend for a couple of extra days, and the hotel was more than accommodating to our request. The Business Center is well equipped, and the front desk staff are more than helpful. Highly recommend the Bascillio Restaurant, every item on the menu there is superb, and Chef Angelo truly does take a lot of pride in his food and training his staff. Location wise, the hotel is situated perfectly next to a basic needs shopping center, and is a short 5 minute walk to Orchard Road and the main city center.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: rather pricey due to the good location, walking distance from the great shopping stretch of orchard road. excellent high tea buffet served during weekends as well. comfortable beds but not a good choice of hotel if you're on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Cruiser_2012
Reviews.Content: Excellent service is what stands out for this hotel. From the front desk clerks, bell service, restaurant wait staff, room service staff - all delivered outstanding services throughout our 4-night stay. There was a beautiful plate of cookies delivered to the room in the afternoon on Christmas Day and that was a really nice touch. The hotel is located on a quiet street and conveniently within walking distance of the very busy Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Taras_Bulba_v_SG
Reviews.Content: This property is a little dated, so the rooms are not comparable to newer Four Seasons properties. However the service is what you would expect from a Four Seasons-managed property. This hotel is known in Singapore for its excellent food. Breakfast is by far the best in Singapore, the hotel serves very good Western and Cantonese cuisine. There is also a very good deli downstairs which makes for a good lunch takeaway if you happen to work in the area. Overall this hotel is excellent for business travellers or those not expecting to be in the hotel other than for sleeping and breakfast. It is connected to Tanglin Mall and is near the botanical gardens and Orchard Road. I would choose it any day over more basic business hotels such as Traders which charge similar rates but come nowhere close in terms of class of service, as well as over other upmarket properties such as Shangri-La, Mandarin Oriental, or St Regis, which do have more facilities, but not necessarily better service though they charge far more than Regent. There are some interesting restaurants nearby in Tanglin Shopping Centre (not to be confused with Tanglin Mall) such as the Okinawan one and one of the oldest Indonesian restaurants in Singapore. It is very close to Orchard Road but not directly on it, so you get the best of both worlds in terms of central location but less pedestrian and traffic congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Proven high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaapcon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very viable site for any business meeting. The meeting facilities are flexible, the accommodation is high quality and the staff are clearly well-trained. You are a short walk from the Tangin Mall, Orchard Road and various restuarants. Room rates are reasonable for the quality of the hotel. A no risk booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: I_am_Fira
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old "elegant" style with marble floor and wall. It is located just at one end and behind the busy Orchard road which I like because it's quiet and not crowded. It's only one long block (10 min walk) from Orchard. This is good for anybody who wants to explore the whole Orchard strip as it is the end or the start of the Orchard. There are two sides of lobby area with plenty of comfortable sofa and armchairs for us to sit and relax (or napping). Some businessmen use it as discussion corner. I don't like the way the four elevators are located, in the middle of the building. Every time I stepped out, I had to turn twice to get the right direction both to the room and to go outside the hotel. The room I stayed is spacious. With the King-size bed, a set of working table and a couch, there're still a lot of space. The air-con in the room is too cold even I adjusted the fan to #1 and the temp at 26. I had one dinner and daily breakfast at Basilico. The food at this restaurant is excellent. They serve semi-buffet dinner where we can pick our appetizer and dessert from the buffet counter but select our main course from the menu. I had sea bass which was very good. They also provide variety of breakfast in the morning, western, Asian, and continental which ever we like. The fresh fruit there are also fresh and sweet. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in most respects”
Reviews.Author: polanalyst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days and would return any day! Beautiful hotel exquisitely appointed with public areas fit for a king! The hotel is however about a ten-minute walk to the major shopping malls of Orchard Road but the walk is flat and very pleasant indeed anytime of day or night. My room was spacious although it did look out over a building site to beware of some construction noise which does permeate the quiet room in the early morning. Fast internet was included with my room rate which is now essential. Room fitting were very comfortable with a large flat-screen TV, great TV choices and a lovely bathroom with L'Occitane toiletries. Breakfasts (also included for me) were wonderful - a great mix of Asian and Western staples. Great bakery products and lovely fruit alongside a buffet choice that was enough to get me through the entire day. My only disappointment was the small and somewhat shabby pool area which was not in-keeping with the general opulence of the hotel. This is not really a hotel for those looking for a great time outdoors and there are other hotels in Singapore that might be better for this. Staff and service was terrific though and met every expectation. I must admit I was reluctant to leave. One tip is to take the airport hotel shuttle from arrivals. This costs S$9 and must represent one of the best value shuttles anywhere in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Holiday @ The Regent”
Reviews.Author: Renaoh
Reviews.Content: We check-in at The Regent for a 4-night stay for the Christmas holiday. We were greeted with a nice fragnant upon entering the hotel and our 1st impression of the hotel was good. Check-in was easy and was given a room on the 11th floor, a non-smoking room. Althought I have asked for a room to be away from the lift, I did not expect to be given a room at the end of a long corridor. No big deal for the young, but not for those who have some knee problems. Rooms were big even after having put-in an additional single bed besides the King-bed. The bathroom is of average size, but clean. Honestly, I would have preferred a bathroom with showers instead of a bathtub. I love that the toiletries were from the L'Occitant range. There were plenty of towels and 2 bathrobes and 1 for the small kid. Turn-down was also provided for the night. Breakfast are served from 6:30 to 10:30, on those days when we ate at their coffee-house, the food were cold and the selection limited. For a 4-star hotel, it is really not acceptable. The most hilarious thing for me was on the 2nd day when I ordered sunny-side up eggs, the cook broked the yolks...twice!! On Christmas day, we were surprised when we returned to our room after a long day out exploring Singapore, there were 2 plates of cookies waiting for us in our room. It is really a nice touch, thank you Regent. Overall, the stay was pleasant and I must add that the doormen is most attentive to guests.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dadut
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Regent. The room was just perfect and breakfast was super great with a wide selection of food to choose from! Would stay here again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful staff - ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: YR-LGB
Reviews.Content: Once you get to this level of hotel, the differentiators are quite small. Of course, it is immaculate, the staff well trained, the food very good, decor is tasteful and lovely, and amenities above average. It scores very nicely on all those. So, it was the smaller things that made a difference for me. First, the staff at the front desk was excellent. There was an error on my reservation, handled with no issue. My room had a bit of a musty smell. They attended to it immediately, had another room ready for me if it didn’t meet my needs – which it did on the air con ran a bit. But when the manager tracked me down to make sure I was happy, then sent up chocolates for inconvenience, well they had me. The selection of tea in the room was a cut above – as a tea drinker, I appreciate having good quality tea and a variety. A little thing, but appreciated. Breakfast was great – a wide variety of food, well prepare and presented. The bacon was really crispy – not always available – and just how I like it. I was too late for Sunday afternoon tea, but it looked spectacular – huge and very well done. They were even making very small ice cream cones with freshly made cones. Finally, the location can’t be beat. Right off Orchard, but not in the center of the noise and a short walk to the Botanical Garden – a very nice treat. All and all, I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Joyce C
Reviews.Content: Was a 2D1N stay with my husband. upon arriving, check in was fast. the staff who helped us with the check in was polite and helpful, even took the effort to walk us to the lift. the room was spacious with a sofa. pretty good when call for room service, eat and watch TV. they have quite a few tv channels frm HBO to AXN and Singapore local channels as well. It was clean. Even in the bathroom, you are able to listen to the tv showing. they have got the sound system inside the bathroom, so when you are soaking in the tub, you wont be so bored. As for the swimming pool, its kinda of small. not much of benches as well. There is no free Wifi, its chargable at a nett price per day. Location is good, there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, if you dont feel like walking the way down, you can take the bus and it can lead you all the way to Dobhy Ghout and suntec city an vice versa.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice”
Reviews.Author: snarfley
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business - reasonably priced and conveniently located for shopping on Orchard and Tanglin Place, if that's your thing. Check-in took a bit more time than necessary but the room was spacious and comfortable (and quiet despite construction going on across the street).

Reviews.Title: “the good old regent”
Reviews.Author: michael883
Reviews.Content: I've been few times to the regent, and I found it to be a nice hotel with professional staff. The executive club is very nice, and fitness center too. The room may need a bit of renewal.. Had lunch at their main restaurant, which is beautiful, with really good Italian food, however my experience was spoiled by a very rude indian lady which seems to be in charge. Beside that, avoiding that matter, everything is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in orchard!With great restaurant too.”
Reviews.Author: Georgeboston21
Reviews.Content: Being few times in the regent: brunch, tea lounge, meeting and week end. I personally think that overall is one of the best hotel in Singapore, surely best in orchard. The staff is very professional in all areas, the hotel have a classic well maintain look, and the restaurants are very good, especially the restaurant Basilico, for me have one of the best Italian food in the region! Overall very good value compare to near by hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: captmike_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very spacious, but although I had requested for a single bed, i got a twin bed. The saving grace was that it was an early check-in case, and I got the room. The location is perfect - just off Orchard road and a short walk to the MRT. The gym too is well equipped and I would certainly recommend this hotel for business travellers. The breakfast buffet was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Gleneagles Hospital and Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: opacjkt
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly to Singapore for business and occasionally medical reasons. Need often to be near to both Gleneagles Hospital and Orchard Road. The Regent does all this and has the plus of being an ideal distance from the Botanic Gardens, probably the city's best place to go jogging of a morning (hint: it gets busy after about 7.30am). The hotel has excellent friendly staff, and clocks in rather cheaper than many in its class. Many hotels in Singapore have a foyer overrun by tourists waiting for buses, but the Regent is mercifully free from that. I generally don't eat hotel breakfasts, preferring to find something local outside, but did try one morning here, and found fabulous service at The Regent's Basilico restaurant. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBrok
Reviews.Content: Nice well maintain classic style hotel in the centre of Singapore. Room are a bit old style, but surely good value for a 5 star hotel. Service was very good. In the italian restaurant Basilico I had one of the Best meal of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Redsilas
Reviews.Content: I had to fly to Singapore for medical treatment/consulations from Manila. I needed a cane to walk and was just very slow in my movements. The staff at the Regent were superb in their treatment of me during my stay. They were patient with me at the breakfast buffet and worked with me. The only hiccup I had, which the Regent did everything it could to apologize, was I received wrong directions to one of my medical appointments. It was really just down the street, but I was told to head to Orchard instead of crossing two streets nearby. The Regent sent me a note of apology to include a tray of chocolates. I didn't mind too much (as I got to shopping on the way). I did appreciate the level of concern the Regent took out for me. I also enjoyed the afternoon tea in the main floor area. I didn't mind the excessive noise, as I have a little one at home, and it provided a nice 'white noise' for me while I had tea and read. The service was exceptional too because I was able to just look up and have the waiters attention to refill the tea or request another type of sandwich. I very much enjoyed the breakfast buffett selection. There was a enough of a choice for everyone. Japanese style, British/Aussie style, Indian style, French, and health conscience style too. I was allowed to stay as long as I wanted and read the paper or just eat and go. This hotel also had a nice perk with it's location close to the Tanglin Mall, which housed, to my surprise, a Nando's! Having ate at Nando's quite often in London, it was very much a welcome surprise as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Far from tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: J_B_BEAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. The staff were friendly and the room is huge. We stayed in an executive suite; it has two balconies and 1.5 bathrooms. Things we love: -very nice gym; with cold water, fresh apples, and hot coffee -the lobby -big room (1.5 bathroom, separate sleeping area and living room area) -excellent staff -L'Occitane shampoo, conditioners, lotions, and soaps -Walking distance from Botanical Garden Things we don't like -The property looks old and tired. And the linen looks like they are from couple decades ago. Not what I expected from a Four Seasons (or any luxury hotels). -Far from most tourist spots. Perfect as a business hotel but not so good for romantic getaway. -No views. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for business but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: PDBPatel-NY
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, clean, quite, spacious, best service, GYM, restaurant, professional staff and helpful. walking distance to restaurants, garden and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “It's so old and tired! This is a Four Seasons property?”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2boysVN
Reviews.Content: I checked in and checked right out again aft sitting in my room for about 5 minutes. It was a cross between an embassy suites and a holiday inn. I had a club level room and the staff was first rate and gracious but the hotel is a dump! I went across to the St. Regis and paid $2 more for the a butler, free breakfast and free wifi and a gorgeous hotel and luxurious room. It should be some sort of crime that this hotel is claiming more than 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: fairdinkumpete
Reviews.Content: I have just checked out after a five night stay at this hotel and I haven't got a bad word to say about it. The staff are attentive, and friendly. The location is excellent (walking distance to both the botanic gardens and orchard road). The facilities are perfect for a business hotel and the food is pretty good too (although the club sandwich is not the best I've ever tasted!). I'd read some mediocre reviews of this place before, but I'd certainly stay here again and recommend others to stay here too. I also love the l'occitane shampoo and soaps!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: NickJodySiena
Reviews.Content: The Regent is a great hotel but is tired. The location is central, the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean so in my opinion it ticks all the important boxes. The hotel Breakfast is first class which is also important. I did not use the facilities on this short trip so I cant comment on that. I have nothing negative to comment about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average location poor service lots of better choices at similar prices”
Reviews.Author: Whybear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently booked a night at The Regent to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Having recently stayed at Four Season Sydney, we have great confidence with Regent which is in the same group to deliver the same great customer service we experienced at Four Season, however were hugely disappointed. We booked thru the hotel website for a package which included breakfast, complimentary upgrade to deluxe room and guaranteed late check out. I had specifically selected King room as we have a king bed at home and would not chosen the hotel otherwise if not available. I booked over 2 months prior and clearly stated it was to celebrate our anniversay. However upon check in, a young lady named Gwean rudely told us that the hotel was very busy and that our request could not be honoured and only twin room with two singles were available. She stressed that i had only booked 1 night in a Superior room and my request for a king is only a request and they do not guarantee to honor it. When i told her i had selected King room ages ago and also emailed the hotel earlier, there was no mention of any issue, not only did she not show any customer focus to assist, she arrogantly insist it was our problem. We are seasoned traveller and had recently stayed at both Pan Pacific Singapore and Royal Plaza on Scotts, the first being at a similar price with Regent, whilst the latter being nearly half the price of that, both delivered exceptional customer service and were in a much better location and booking honored as expected. Regent finally providing a king room after my complaint and an hour waiting, and we found an anniversary cake in the room which indicated they knew from our booking, the Regent name will be forever deleted from my choice of hotel. Only service provided of it's class is the taxi man who greeted us warmly every time we meet.

Reviews.Title: “Striking interior, top grade hotel at fair price”
Reviews.Author: Andy7P
Reviews.Content: At north end of Orchard area - you have a little longer walk to reach the main shopping malls (500m). Prices are lower than, say, Hyatt, HIlton or Marriott, at the Orchard/Scotts intersection, this may be the reason. The lobby is eye-catching - multiple levels with the elevators in the middle. Very popular with weddings, and they had an afternoon tea buffet that local people seemed to enjoy (Singaporeans seem to love eating at all opportunities). Room is large, and in spotless condition. Decorated in floral pastel colors, classic look rather than a modern style. So depends on your taste. This may be why some reviewers think it needs an upgrade, not sure I agree. Everything is good, staff are super friendly, breakfast selection / quality was extremely good. My small complaint: they have a dual speed internet policy which I found annoying, I don’t want to pay extra for "premium" speed

Reviews.Title: “Building needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: berray
Reviews.Content: Whilst the overall building needs an upgrade I was also not so happy with the service especially in the morning during breakfast there was a lady manager on duty that was pretty unpleasant to staff plus customers. This was not a v good experience - don't like to see this

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, great service standards.”
Reviews.Author: Mush5273
Reviews.Content: Good location not far from Orchard Rd shopping. Excellent staff from the bell guys to reception through the F & B. Basilico has the best breakfast and lunch buffets of any hotel I've been in, great food. The gym is ok a little small especially for the mornings but the locker has a sauna and steam which is handy. The rooms are nice with large screen TVs and excellent beds. Recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Madras_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.. Beautiful ambience... Neat classy decor.. Lovely breakfast spread and courteous staff! Can be a little pricey but its definetly worth it! I definetly recommend this hotel for ppl travelling to singapore!

Reviews.Title: “4,5 stars --> just 0,5 more thing...”
Reviews.Author: Damonhakim
Reviews.Content: It was a business trip + medical check-up trip. We tried finding hotels we havent been before and we found The Regent. We took the suite and here's the overall experience: SIZE: For a singapore hotel, this hotel is big in terms of size. The lobby is very spacious and space-generous. INTERIOR: The interior is old-style, but don't get me wrong, doesn't mean its bad. It is an old hotel, but they did tremendous job on maintaining it. So even though it 'looks' old, it doesn't 'feel' old. Its very clean, and everything seems to be in place and well-placed. STAFF - SERVICE: The staffs here are super helpful. Arriving at the receptionist I was served by this young lady (she was pregnant at that time, sorry i forgot her name) and she's very helpful. The room wasn't ready when we arrive, yet my wife needs to feed our baby, so she quickly arrange a room in the fitness and spa center for us to use freely, without even telling us how long we can use it (small gesture, big appreciation). At the 2nd night we heard a loud noise coming from the room above us, some guys seems to be having party and i think they opened the balcony window so the noise spreads out well. It was around 22.00 PM and our baby was sleeping. I called to reception, told them if there's anything they can do about the noise, and the next 3 minutes later, the manager himself come to our room (a young man, sorry again i forgot his name) to check the noise himself. He apologize and said will take care of it right away (he seems pissed by the noise and i can see he works fast by the way he walks, heheh...very good). 5 minutes later, the noise is GONE. And 5 minutes after that, the manager calls again and ask if everything ok now, and said if the noise happens again, he'll ask the guest to leave the hotel and he had also placed some securities around that room to make sure the noise won't come again. It didn't :) So yeah, when it comes to service, this is one of the best among the many hotels I've been. FACILITIES: I didn't use any of their facilities like pool, etc, but the in-room of the suite are good. Looking at the size, i dont think they have a problem with other facilities. ROOM: The suite is nice. Clean, good comfy fluffy bed and pillows. One of the beds is a bit shaky and when i checked its because one of the bed-feet is broken, but it wasn't a big deal cause its not that bad. They saw us bringing a baby, so when we enter the room, a baby bathtub is already in the bathroom, a set of baby products is in the cot (we ordered a cot). We have 2 big LCDs (1 in bedroom, 1 in living room). The living room comes with TV + Home theatre set. The bottled water is provided like bottomless. They checked every morning if u need more things for the room, and since we need lots of water for the baby things, we asked a lot of bottled water, and without any problem, we got many :) LOCATION: This is the only thing that made me not giving them the rest of the 0.5 stars. The downside: It took you at least 15 mins walk down to orchard for MRT. We took taxi around so no problem bout the transport. But if you plan to take MRT, it would be quite a walk. But then again, singapore is a walking city / country. Its just not convenient when its rainy season (which was the season we were having when we stayed here) Not many restaurants around too. The Upside: Its only 15 mins walk to orchard! OVERALL: Will recommend, will stay here again. Good for family, biz, couples, solo, whatever. Thanking the staff (who might be reading this) for the service, and I apologize for not remembering those great staffs' names. Btw, I forgot to bring home my mac charger, and called their hotel the next night (I'm back at Jakarta) and they looked for it, called me, found it, kept it, and I asked my friend to take it for me, done. Thanks again for that one :) Hope this review helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and in the very best location”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay, actually much better than expected. The nice old Regent brand has mostly disappeared but not yet in Singapore as The Four Seasons is just round the corner and having a different owner would object a name change of the Regent into Four Seasons... Anyway. First things first. The location is just wonderful. Next to Orchard road yet tucked away in a nice quieter road. The hotel is one of those huge hotels so typical to Singapore in the 80s where everything revolves around a huge inner courtyard. The touches in the public areas are quite nice and the service level is high. I'd give the property 5 stars were it not for the slightly outdated rooms and bathrooms (shower in the bathtub etc., quite old-fashioned). Apart from that all else was top notch and no complaints. Try to find a good deal for the Regent on one of the many booking sites. It's a huge hotel and there are regularly deals to be had. I wish the wonderful Regent brand was to be revived.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location but noisy !”
Reviews.Author: griswalds59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is probably 4 star and a little dated but very close to orchard road . Our problem was the construction site outside our window ! Singaporeans are very hard workers as the workers on site proved by starting jackhammering drilling concrete poles and pouring concrete from 7am all day through rain, hail, sunshine until after 8 at night. If you would like a rest probably steer clear of the Regent until building work is complete.

Reviews.Title: “big name with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: limwiehan
Reviews.Content: its my first time to stay in four season managed hotel when i enter REgent Singapore. I put my expectation low as it is quite old hotel and also i pay quite low price compare to other hotels in the area. The lobby is impressive, receptionist is professional. overall i have a feeling that this hotel has standard in servicing. The room is big and comfortable. I would back again to this hotel. the location is closed to tanglin mall and forum mall in orchard. love the location, as it is quite but still close to the scene.

Reviews.Title: “treated very well at the Regent!”
Reviews.Author: go4bows
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at the Regent. Was on the 11th floor, which has the club, and that was really nice. Very personalized service. You would never get this kind of service in the US, even in the best hotels. What a wonderful breakfast in the restaurant! I would have loved to do the afternoon tea but you need to make a reservation. I would definitely stay here again .....

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: chungkk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Regent for 2 nights. The hotel is close to Orchard Rd and it takes around 10mins walk to the train station. This is an old five stars hotel, the room is clean and big enough but it's have outdated interior. The cleaning staffs are very considerate, hotel provided us one bottle of water per night, the first night they placed the water in the mini bar. As my normal practices I will put the water next to bed during night time and I have left the empty bottle next to my bed, the next day the cleaning staff have put the new bottle of water next to my bed, although this is a small things, they make me so warm~

Reviews.Title: “Old luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Nasution
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in so many hotels in Singapore, with all kinds of range, luxurious, business, til the backpacker style. This hotel is one of the most memorable ones. The room is luxurious, spacious and of course squeaky clean. Room facilities are truly 5 stars, breakfast quality is splendid. It's a hotel which has the old comfort and luxury and doing the best to keep the high standard. Even the doormen are all smiles and friendly, quick to response. It's a kind of hotel that you would like to stay for business, leisure and even with noisy and active kids. Super. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located”
Reviews.Author: AniWard
Reviews.Content: The Regent's location is probably its strongest part. Close to Orchard Rd and Botanic Garden, it is in a nice and peaceful area. The Regent is large, the room was clean but not impressive, but the gym was very nice although small.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and warm ambience”
Reviews.Author: traveljet
Reviews.Content: We are locals and decided to take a 3 night getaway, attending a wedding dinner at the hotel on the 2nd night. We drove in on a Friday 30th Sept 2011 and checked out on Monday 3rd Oct - no problem getting complimentary parking coupons from the Concierge. Our request for a non-smoking quiet room on a higher floor was granted without fuss (1018). The room was decorated with warm colours and toiletries were "L'Occitane" products. This package came with an upgrade to the Deluxe room. There was a slight problem with the drainage in the tub the 2nd day but it was very efficiently dealt with when we called Housekeeping. We were very comfortable relaxing in the room which came with a study table and large screen TV, good supply of tea bags. A big bonus was the free internet service with came with the package. Bed was great for sleeping - nice big pillows. Its a good idea to give Housekeeping a call to make up the room when you go for breakfast. They attended to that efficiently. One thing that stood out for us at the Regent was the friendliness of the staff. A far cry from a 6 Star hotel down the road which is often cold and impersonal. So the smiles and pleasant service at The Regent truly made us very welcome. - The efficiency of the breakfast staff in clearing the plates on our table was very good. Staff Lin Chang stood out in this area - very sharp and quick. The breakfast spread served the best French Toast we have ever tasted (but it rotates with waffles & pancake on diff days - the french toast was served on Sat). Unfortunately our request for French Toast the next day could not be met. We wish they could have been a little more flexible in this area. The chef stationed at the bread section wasnt busy so we wished she could have been more flexible. I asked her on Sun and the friendly staff went to asked her on Mon on our behalf - flat no. Perhaps it was a different chef who prepared the French Toast on Sat. These little things make a big difference - nevertheless we do understand its a big hotel and they can choose not to grant personal requests. They served japanese rice & miso soup - but it was rather strange and didnt make sense for many of the condiments and pickles to be placed at another station near the fruits. Most of us wouldnt know there were other condiments for the rice. The Congee was fine on Sat morning but was too thick and goeey the next 2 days. The baked bacon (tad salty but tender) and honey ham were very nicely done. Enjoyed the freshly squeezed orange juice that came with the coffee. The Room package included breakfast - if it didnt, then we think $47 would have been too steep and we wouldnt have dined there every morning. The Regent created a warm and welcoming ambience for us - most refreshing compared to many other hotels here. Most definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Moderate Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cb1180
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regent Hotel for 5 nights on a business trip and it was a relatively nice stay. The rooms weren’t all that special, but the staff was very friendly and accommodating. I checked in to a king room which had two twin beds, which I wasn’t thrilled about, but wasn’t upset enough to request a change. Upon returning to the room on the afternoon of the 3rd day, the room smelled like cigarette smoke. I couldn’t tell where it was coming from so I, contacted the front desk. They sent housekeeping up (within 5 min of the call), who confirmed the smell and offered to talk to the front desk to see about a room change. Within another 5 min I received a call from the front desk and they offered a new room and asked what time they could send up a bell hop. The new room was a king room with a king size bed (surprise! :)) and a little larger than the first one! So all in all I would rate the service outstanding. As for the rooms themselves, the décor was a little dated; however the twice daily housekeeping certainly keeps them in good, clean, shape. The bathrooms were nice and the L’Occitane soaps are awesome! Internet was pretty good and free for the first 3 nights. Utilized the Regent Club for breakfast and cocktails; again the staff was friendly and the food good. The restaurants were a little too pricey for my taste so I chose to eat else-ware. Value – well this is a little bit of a tough one. Overall I would say it’s a bit pricey for what you get, however my stay partially included the F1 Grand Prix period. This time period makes it difficult to get a room anywhere and all the hotels increase their prices – supply and demand – I know. So having said that, the first 3 nights rate was reasonable and the last 2 (increase of approx. $175 a night and loss of Club privileges) was not a value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good pick for Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnpedwards
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at the Regent in Singapore, second time I've been there. It's a good hotel for the price - Comfortable well-appointed rooms, excellent service from the staff, and beautiful interior (although not updated for some time, it's still very nice). The location is great for shipping, restaurants, & pubs. Some construction in the area (and they work at night), but it's not very disturbing. I'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not nice construction site”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra S
Reviews.Content: We've just checked into the Regent several hours ago. My husband and I were told by the front desk that they were assigning us a room with a Queen bed, and though we had reserved one with a King that was fine for us. However, when we arrived at the assigned room it actually had two twin beds, which is unacceptable for a weekend with my husband. Additionally the room looked directly into a noisy construction zone. The personal at the reception desk was very friendly and tried to resolve the issue, but unfortunately did not have other rooms available to switch us to without the construction site. We did get a king bed, but on a smoking floor (slight smell) and even louder construction as it is two floors down from the first room. They are offering to move us to another room tomorrow, but considering we are only here for 2 "relaxing" days I don't think we will opt to pack and move again. I find this situation unacceptable for a hotel of this class. We paid a very full price for this room, and are getting much less than we are supposed to be (construction hammers are not in my relaxation plans). If the hotel had sold discounted rooms with a notification of view over construction that would be perfectly normal and acceptable, but this is just not. My husband travels here for business often, and although he has had a good experience with the Regent in the past he probably will not choose it again due to this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of an makeover in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: zydeco34
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in July in a junior suite. The room was looking tired and in need of new carpet or clean carpet. One bed looked like it had been slept in and the duvet pulled up. The maid service always came when we returned to the room in late afternoon when you don't want to be bothered by a maid service. The powder room vanity did not drain nor did the main bathroom vanity. A note left for housekeeping did not see this resolved during our stay. If you are afraid of heights this is not the hotel for you as the lift well is in the centre with skybridges with low railings out to rooms. The lobby area is lovely. The hotel porters very helpful as were concierge staff. We didn't sample the restaurants or room service. Bath products were L'Occitane - very nice. The location of the hotel is great with easy access to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TonyB_au
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel close to the shopping hub of Singapore (Orchard Road). I couldn't stay at my normal hotel so I tried this for a change. I didn't get a chance to explore the hotel as I was working all day and out for dinner at night but my observations are: 1. Arrival - Not good. I had to get my own bag from the taxi while the doorman watched me. 2. Checkin - slow and they tried to upsell the executive floor. I hate that. 3. Room - Very good. Nice and big. 4. Bed - excellent. I had a great sleep. Bed and pillows were top class. 5. Working area - very good. Nice desk, Wired and wireless internet, plenty of powerpoints 6. Amenities - Very good quality soap and shampoo etc. (L'Occitane brand). Plenty of tea and coffee available. 7. Breakfast - not a huge selection but it was enough for me. However, it cost SG$47 for breakfast so I didn't go back again. That's overpriced in my opinion (and I wasn't even paying for it). 8. Scenery from the window - A building site 9. Checkout - Slow...and the guy was trying to be too friendly. Hotel Owners - here's a tip for you: When I'm on business I'm in a hurry. I want efficient service, I don't want to be your friend!!! Summary - Good hotel but the expensive breakfast ruined it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgezgin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regent for 2 nights in September. We arrived at the hotel at around 2pm to check in, but our room was not available. So we end up leaving our luggages at the hotel to explore the city. We completed our check in at night. The first impression of the room was not great because of some smell due to high humidity. But the bedding was comfortable, especially the pillows. In the morning I realized that there is a construction going on nearby. If you plan to spend long times during the day in your room, the noise will disturb you, so plan on booking a room which doesn't face the construction site. Other services, including the concierge and the doorman were very good. The breakfast was excellent, except that the brad selection and the quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Singapore stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicTim10
Reviews.Content: Warm and helpful welcome for 2 sleep-deprived and jet-lagged travellers. We were kinly allowed to use the gym showers and change rooms to freshen up, then we lay by the pool until our room was ready (a few hours earlier than the official time). Loved the breakfast, great surroundings, quiet, clean, super-friendly and obliging staff and most of all, a fantastic location to stay in for visiting Singapore. You're just a minute or two from Orchard Road, 10 minutes to Ion Orchard and the MRT. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicolaAlpe
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at The Regent recently when we changed our flights home to include a Sunday brunch at The Four Seasons Singapore. With that hotel booked we stayed at The Regent, managed by Four Seasons. It was everything you would expect really - lovely lobby, gorgeous scented candles and floral arrangements, good amenities and excellent proximity to Orchard Road shopping! We ended up being in walking distance of brunch too - which was handy! The rooms are also what you would expect - spacious, nice marble bathroom, good bed. The decor is typical 'big hotel' so don't expect a contemporary feel or recently refurbished room. That said it really didn't matter as most of our time was spent out eating or shopping! WiFi was the fastest ever in a hotel which was invaluable as we were back into work by this stage. We ordered room service one evening and it was outstanding. The service was quick, the Room Service Manager was helpful and accommodating and it was beautifully presented. I would eat that room service again in a heartbeat! Overall a very good place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly be back if...”
Reviews.Author: ufo007
Reviews.Content: Unlike other singapore Hotel for same price range , this is certainly spacious walkable to Orchard. Good choice for travellers especially from India as good restaurants for Desi food e.g Komala , Indian Grill etc.Else Hotel has number of dinning options if you pressed for time. Rooms are clean , spacious and neat. We loved the lobby and bar with pool table , you can play game late evening over couple of drinks.Only negative is Check-In is 3 PM and they make you wait or you book for previous night which is strict no-no. I would be back only if they improve on ChecK-In timmings. Those who take overnght flight from Mumbai needs to have prior night booking or else you take day flight and waste your day.

Reviews.Title: “Special birthday stay”
Reviews.Author: RoRoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Regent on numerous occasions when traveling between Australia and Europe, which in itself shows we think it's a great hotel. This time was special. When the staff found out it was my husband's birthday, they went out of their way to make our stay memorable. A birthday cake arrived in our room in mid-afternoon and in the Basilico restaurant that evening Parul and Joecel did everything they could to ensure we had a wonderful evening. Well done and thanks. We're now looking forward to our return visit in September.s

Reviews.Title: “Cannot have a better place to stay:)”
Reviews.Author: fauziafarhan
Reviews.Content: Near orchard rd which is the most happening place in Singapore.friendly staff,excellent breakfast.we were upgraded with our room without any extra charges.I asked them to keep our luggage in locker room which they did:)even after our check out and the girl at the front desk told us abt the changing room after we come back from the tired day to collect our luggage so that we can freshen up.In one word PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service for family stopover”
Reviews.Author: Mossfjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regent for 2 nights as a stopover on our way to Europe. We arrived late and found our room had been set up to accommodate our 2 year old daughter (cot, baby products) as well as a gingerbread man and milk. We found the room to be very comfortable. Staff were the highlight of the hotel. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. They even gave my daughter a stuffed toy (thank you Pauline). We would highly recommend the Regent for those traveling with children and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: kchabbs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located,jus off the Orchard street. That street is definitely a shoppers delight. I haven't seen so many malls at the same place anywhere else. Rooms are nice. The lobby is small with a small bakery shop on one side and the entrance is always decorated with beautiful rare orchid flowers. Concierge is pretty helpful. Booked my tickets for universal studios with them. They even keep your bags incase you check out a little and still have time to spare before your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: scotstjej
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family to this hotel. I have nothing but praise for the level of service provided. On arrival our room was not available so we were treated to some refreshments while the room was made ready for us. We also received a small box of complimentary chocolates and a handwritten note from the assistant manager. Now that level of service makes me smile:) We stayed in a Regent Club room. It was nice and spacious with a writing desk, and nice comfortable sofa, coffee table, nice comfy bed and plenty of storage for our clothes and belongings. The bathroom was nice and functional, very spacious and provided what you would expect of an hotel of this level. We had room service but I was slightly disappointed with the club sandwich. The only other negative comment I have to make is that the hairdryer provided was not particularly useful. You have to keep a button depressed whilst using it and there was no obvious place to dry hair. The staff at this hotel were wonderfully friendly, happy and service minded. The Regent Club breakfast buffet was very nice. We did go down to the standard breakfast buffet on the 2nd floor on our last day but felt that the buffet provided in the Regent Club was most definitely comparable and it was nice up in the Regent Club, quieter, calmer and less stressful. Unfortunately we were unable to use the swimming pool but it looked like it would have been very nice to swim and relax in that area. Overall a fantastic hotel and hope we will return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel property in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nakulm
Reviews.Content: This was my best stay in Singapore, we moved from Festive hotel to The Regent and repented that we should have skipped Festive and stayed here only. The hotel staff starting from the reception is very freindly & helpfull. The buffet breakffast in the coffe shop is very grand and yummy. The hotel though being old is very well maintained. It lacks a baby pool. The rooms are spacious and nice. The location is also very convineient.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Want to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Calyan
Reviews.Content: We were just staying here for 1 night in order to rest for our flight back to the UK the next day. This turned to be an amazing hotel. The room was very nice and spacious with a nice bathroom. The restaurant however was possibly one of the best that I have ever been to too. It was Italian and the dishes were astounding. The rooms were quiet at night so a good night's sleep was possible. The location was also very handy right by the shopping street of Orchard Road. Breakfast was good with a wide selection of anything you could want. The buffet lunch was a slight let down with many choices but none of them really tasted amazing. Also the pool wasn't very big either. So overall this was a great hotel which I will return to and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but so expensive-- not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: NZSpursFan
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Singapore for 3 nights en route to New Zealand and stayed in the Regent. We liked the hotel and there were lots of facilities. Nice room and bathroom. We even had bathrobes and slippers. Reception was very helpful when we discovered we had left something on the transfer bus. Good selection on TV. However, as most hotels are room only in Singapore, we enquired about breakfast and were told it would cost us about £22 each! We went to McDonalds instead! Souvenirs were pricy. Everybody in Singapore seems to be trying to sell to tourists and it is so commercialised. We only saw real homes on our journey to and from the airport, which was disappointing. Shops were no cheaper than UK and Changi Airport was much more expensive than Britain! We felt that Singapore is very over-commercailised these days, and very different from when I was last there 30 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Belle90
Reviews.Content: Good ubication Excellent service and staff I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again when next in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kimjackson
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay here on the way back from 4 weeks in Spain, for a little R'n'R and to break up the flight back to Australia. As a former travel agent, I am familiar with just above every hotel in Singapore but didn't know anyone who had stayed at this little gem and of the seven or so I have stayed in this is by far my favourite. The location is great (very easy walk to shops and transport) but feels just a little quieter than being directly on Orchard Road. It is ageing, but the attention to detail with clealiness and upkeep is fantastic and I would not say it is past it's prime. My husband booked us in to the Club room, which was a bargain. Our room was large, bright and very comfortable. The club lounge had a great little snacks area and the drinks in the early evening were a nice bonus, it was lovely being able to have a little snack and drink before heading out for dinner each night. We chose to have breakfast in the restaurant downstairs (instead of the lounge) and really enjoyed it - there was a great array to choose from and all great quality. Big thumbs up to the staff all over the hotel, who were very friendly, helpful and professional without fault. Not a single staff member (out of the dozens we came into contact with) were "average" - all were fantastic, but especially the Club Lounge staff. It was the small details that made the stay here special, the gorgeous flowers everywhere, the turndown service, the fresh face towel and glass of water when you sit by the pool... I just really hope it is exactly as it is now, next time we are in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: rdabca
Reviews.Content: On first impression I felt like I was back in the 1970's. The hotel doesn't seem as if it has changed a bit since then. It is very well maintained though and after a while I quite enjoyed the retro vibe. Rooms were comfortable. I thought the buffet breakfast was excellent with an huge array of choices and if you don't find anything you like there is a chef who will cook to order. We used the pool and it was spacious and uncrowded. Prices seemed a bit high in the bar. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: neutron0911
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regent Singapore with my family for 3 nights while en route from Sydney to Kuala Lumpur. The place is a little dated but the rooms that we were in had recently been freshened up and were quite acceptable. The location was central enough for us - we walked everywhere. Service was fine, food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Far too close to the shops!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunloverMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after a disaster in Bintan!!!! Treated like VIPs when entered hotel!!!!! Room was upgraded, nut have a feeling they do that for everyone!!!! Only strange thing was the toilet was really low, would be a problem if you have difficulties getting up!!! Very good location for The Botanical Gardens and Orchard Road. Pool was a little disappointing. Breakfast was great, make sure it is included in the room rate, as expensive otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A1bs
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel enjoyable is the great service from the staff. The hotel itself is nice enough but maybe a bit dated, the rooms are large and comfortable but the bathroom is the only let down.

Reviews.Title: “Professional services, good location”
Reviews.Author: Razmanmv
Reviews.Content: This hotel has provided me with professional services, and I feel really pleased with this. The staff are all well-trained and very friendly. They speak good English also. I find it easy to communicate with them. The hotel's location is another prasing point. It takes just a few minutes to reach interesting sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MsJetset
Reviews.Content: Still great service as ever. Probably not much that they can't help with (including conjuring taxis out of nowhere!) that they can't help with if you ask, and always so courteous. Breakfast and restaurants (esp Basilico) super.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cityflyer418
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel need to renovation. Room's furniture was old and with the vestige of dirt. Bathroom was the most serious suffered with this issue. The maintaince of this hotel in good condition is a big challenge. The location was fine if you want to be little bit away from the noisy center. It take you 10 to 15mins walk to Forum Shopping Mall and another 5mins to ION orchard to MRT. Hotel service was the only achievement of this hotel. Anyhow, it's only can rate as four star hotel only.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, Good Location but truly Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Tysin30
Reviews.Content: Ok the rooms are not great, good size but tired. However the food and service is great at this hotel. The manager of the F&B is great, really was a nice guy and did everything to make sure the stay was enjoyable. The staff at breakfast, lunch and dinner were outstanding, especially the two young ladies from the Philippines, one of which is getting married soon, the bar staff are excellent also. I usually stay at St Regis or Intercontinental but for service and food The Reagent is excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the understated panache of an old dame of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ranjini050
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, you are met with a melange of beige's and other pastels and someone appears - magically your bags disappear and you are gently ambled through to reception. The receptionists with the marle grey suits, pink blouses with two "pearl" buttons greet you by name and in a few minutes you are checked-in and escorted to the large atrium with the pentagonal lift well. Look up and enjoy the the large piece of art dropping from this cavernous space. The lifts are golden bubbles of see through delight as you smoothly ascend to your floor - reminding me a of a 1990's movie scene. I was upgraded to the governor's suite. It was so large that I started laughing aloud. the bed was volumptously comfortable, the bathroom large and well stocked with deliciously soft and large towels, L'Occitaine bath products, more than ample closet space, a profusion of beiges and pastels that at first reminded me of a scene from an American movie about presidents. I felt I needed an advisor or a character from Dallas to appear with a vodka martini and big hair ala Joan Collins. The reception room had a wooden table for 6, lounge area, tv and the usual amenities amd a guest toilet. Dilma tea and a Nespresso machine - but alas no George Clooney. The rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious - so if you need to get away from the claustraphobia of shopping, or the tourist traps you will more than likely enjoy the quietness of your room. I had a lovely view and a balcony to sit and sip a Singapore sling or a G&T. Kick off your shoes and rest your travel weary feet on the soft carpet as you lounge on the setee. Staff are an asset. Genuienly friendly, curteous and not pretentious. From the doormen, luggage service, reception, breakfast areas - it was a pleasure to talk to the staff - to feel human again. Excellent and consistent service. They listened first to what you needed / requested and then delivered. Gym: smallish but adequately equippied with some trainers on hand to help you with the weights etc or for a bit of eye candy whilst you are dripping with sweat running. Water, coffee, towels etc are all provided in the gym. Pool was outdoor and more of the lounge style - not for laps but for frolickling or sitting on the deck chairs enjoying a book or the papers. Internet access is provided in the business centre - a comfortable quite spot. 3 pc's provided with a fax /printer, setee. Breakfast is more like a feast - everything is provided - from Asian style breakfasts to European style. I asked for something that was a little unusual and with no fuss or quizzical looks it was made for me. One staff member came by and chatted to me about my travels - that was a welcome break from the dreary news in the papers. In-room dinning at most places can be a torturous experience. Here it was not and the in-room dining staff were fanstatic - the food was par excellence and the service - silver service on a trolley. A waiter appeared, laid out the dinning table with precision and efficiency, and the food - I requested a particular way I wanted my meal prepared - it was prepared exactly how I requested. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal - however no George Clooney to end the meal with. Location: Not on the main drag of Orchard road but if you are in Singapore for a few days, being away from the heady racausness of Orchard Road is a bonus. Hotel is a short stroll from Orchard road. I had an early check-out - 4am and had requested a taxi the previous day. Taxi was ready and waiting for me. Staff is an asset and the Regent acheives the aim of looking after guests and not being so full of itself. It really is the old dame of Singapore without the hyperinflated prices.

Reviews.Title: “A very classy hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Regent and I was not disappointed. It is an elegant, understated hotel perfect for the tired transit traveller. The rooms are spacious and attractive, and the beds heavenly. The service is impeccable and friendly. We had one room service meal during our stay and it was very good - much better than usual hotel room service fare. The location near Orchard Road is excellent. About my only complaint would be that internet is not complementary, but the rates are reasonable. Overall, I really cannot fault this fine hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The Regent is located close to Orchard Street and the botanic garden. The Singapore Flyer, Universal Studios are also a 10 minute ride away. The hotel has an amazing gym and a luxurious steam room and jacuzzi. The rooms are cozy and comfortable. I tried their high tea which was good. Breakfast was excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive to detail

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoMelbourne_10
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in deluxe room. Very nice rooms, housekeeping excellent, breakfast good. Location was very good at the end of Orchard Rd, near Botanical Gardens. Only gripe was building work across the road which was noisy if you wanted a nap in the daytime. Wish they had put us elsewhere being non-business people who returned to our room during the day. Apart from that, this is a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: kcarta
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Regent in Singapore. The location was good, service was great, lobby was beautiful. This was my first stay in a five country trip, so I have to admit they started to blur together. However, I clearly remember ranking The Regent as 4 star (with the only true 5 star being the Shangri-La in Tai Pei.)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: autobrake3
Reviews.Content: Situated 5 minutes walk from Orchard Rd MRT it is conveniently located. At the same time it is just away from the noise and hustle of the main streets. It has all the features expected of a 5 star although to be minutely picky the rooms and corridors are slightly dated but nevertheless perfectly clean and very comfortable. Only ate breakfast which was good standard buffet fare. For the price I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal! This hotel doesn't deserve 3 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi1Traveler
Reviews.Content: After roughing it on a Thai beach (where I had free high-speed broadband), I decided to treat myself to three nights at a 5 star in Singapore.
