I picked the Regent primarily because it was a Four Seasons property AND advertised free internet. I had noted TripAdvisor reviews complaining about their charging so was now confident that I would be able to Skype video with my little daughter. I arrived to a nice lobby which then deteriorated into my room. I swear this room had the feel of a tired, old Russian hotel whwre they tried to cosmetically spruce it up....complete with wrinkly carpets and all! Anyway, I siged and signed on to the "free" internet only to find dial-up speed incapable of anything but a slow email upload. At almost US$400 per night then I got the insulting message that if I wanted to upgrade to PREMIUM SPEED, I'd have to pay more. Too late to go to another hotel, I checked out the next morning, told them I was disgusted that they would crank down the speed on purpose only to annoy and exasperate their guests into buying a premium speed. The breakfast buffet was forgettable as well. Forget about using this rip-off, possibly 3-star at best, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was an elegant hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: KathyNoni
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for only one night, after an Asian cruise, and it was an unexpected thrill that it was so lovely, especially for the price (220.00).

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive visually but not great sound insulation”
Reviews.Author: johnny_5_bellys
Reviews.Content: Checked in late here for one night, hotel was pricey (SGD 400++) for a delux room but very visually opulent (with a central glass lift taking you to air walkways). The room was fine but Iwas not over the moon that I could hear running water from other rooms. The bed was okay but did not have a luxury feel to it. Apart from that, the experience was very good and breakfast excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Total breach of security - TERRIBLE CS”
Reviews.Author: Veegd
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation to stay for 1 night on the 12th Feb because I was to attend a conference held in the same hotel, and so arrived that afternoon around 4pm (note that check-in starts at 2pm). When I entered my room, there was a ladder in the doorway and a hole in the ceiling. I was told that the doorbell was out of order and they were trying to fix it. The duty manager offered to change my room and asked me to wait in the room for her call. A few minutes came by and the repair man and his (I presume) supervisor came and said they were told they could work on the room until 7pm, but since I've checked into the room anyway, they will remove the ladder and I can stay. So I assumed that the duty manager had told the staff about this arrangement, and I left the room to explore the area, leaving my duffel bag in the room, a wet swimsuit on the chair to dry, and my passport in the safe. When I returned at 7pm, my bag and swimsuit were gone! I called the operator and she relayed the message from the duty manager (who couldn't be available at the time to talk to me) that they had "told me already" that they would change my room, and they "tried calling but I didn't pick up" (my phone was turned off to avoid roaming charges), and so they decided to remove my baggage and wait for me to contact them on my return. Not only did they not leave a message to let me know what had happened, they never apologised for removing my things without my permission, prior knowledge or presence. The operator said they'll have the bell boy send up the luggage asap, and after 10 minutes of waiting around (and my friend circling outside the front entrance in his car because he wasn't allowed to park and wait for me), I called the operator again and she said she had already "pleaded" with the bell boy to bring it to me. I thought that's what bell boys do right? They had to PLEAD with him!? I offered to get the luggage myself if it was that troublesome to transfer a piece of luggage from G/F to 4/F. The operator said it's all the duty manager's idea so I asked to see her. Anyway, the luggage arrived and shortly afterwards the duty manager came. Whilst I was trying to explain to her that it's unacceptable to have your luggage removed from your room after checking in without letting the customer's approval, she tried to speak over me and said things like "I see your point of view, I see where you're coming from". In my speak, that means she doesn't agree with me that the hotel staff was at fault here. No apologies, nothing, she tried to brush the whole thing away. Why couldn't they have checked if the room was ready first before letting someone in? The internal communication between the staff was non-existent. After this experience, anything else didn't matter that much, but I'll give a brief summary: so-so location (at the top of Orchard road, but far from other tourist attractions), old-fashioned building (reminds me of the ones in mainland China, faux glam and old-school renovation), reasonably appetising buffet breakfast, small pool, terrible service. For SGD250 a night, I think there are other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - just a bit old”
Reviews.Author: chailatte888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. Location is fantastic, extremely close to orchard and the botanical gardens. The lobby is modern, however, once you get up to the levels for the rooms, its extremely bare and dated. This is a four seasons hotel, so all the amenities and furniture is fantastic, however nice furniture in an old room - is not what one would expect in Singapore. Overall, great stay, big rooms. Just a bit tired looking. Service is fantastic and one of the better hotels I have stayed in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Looks the part but looks can be deceiving"”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: As a Four Seasons Hotel my expectations were high but sadly the level of service at the front desk was a let down from the get go. Unlike many other hotels that claim to be in the luxury category the check-in was perfunctory and uninformative, calls to the front desk went unanswered and on check out it was combative over the bill (inclusions that were extras required clarification to my advantage) and sour faces to boot. The Basilico restaurant breakfast is good with a reasonable selection and nice friendly service, as was housekeeping and room service. To peak off my visit there was a lot of noisy renovation work underway (without explanation before or during the stay) which made staying in the room (to work) difficult. A nice hotel but in need of a front desk overhaul and perhaps a little modernisation here and there. Not a bad hotel but not for me again.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Bizzy80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the regent for 6 nights in november '10 for part of our honeymoon, & what a fantastic hotel. A good tip is to email them before hand advising them of any requests and if its a special occasion & they will do their best to meet them. We arrived at 9am, check isn't usually till 3pm. They said they would try to check us in for 1pm but managed to do it by 11am. They sent a congratulations cake to the room & then later some complimentary flowers in a lovely vase, which was a wonderful touch. The location was perfect for us. Situated at the very top of Orchard Road (the main shopping hub-great sight even if you hate shopping like me), you can have a nice stroll down the road capturing everything. Service at the hotel was brilliant. Staff were always on hand to help with anything and very friendly. We stayed in a deluxe room with a balcony which was spacious, comfortable and cleaned every day.I would definately reccomend a bed & breakfest package as their breakkie spread was amazing with just so much variety. Overall this hotel exceeded our expectations & was just a fantastic start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service..ok property”
Reviews.Author: mangoose
Reviews.Content: The USP of the hotel is its staff. Really caring and helpful people-right from the bell boys to the top chefs. The top chef of the Italian restaurant prepared a special dinner for us on new year’s eve even though the hotel was having a set gala buffet. Check in and checkout were both smooth. In most hotels the concierge desk can be used only for getting a taxi. Not in Regent- the concierge will give you details of tourist spots, the best way to reach them and even tips which no guide book can have. The property itself is not jaw dropping. The Christmas decorations were good but overall nothing great about the property. We stayed in the deluxe room on the 11th floor which was spacious and had all the important amenities but nothing extraordinary. The pool is quite small-may be ok for a swim but not great if you want to spend some time there. The hotel is not located on the Orchard road but most of the orchard attractions are within walking distance. Overall it is a great hotel if you are more interested in the service than the property. It is expensive but so is everything else in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definately Return”
Reviews.Author: TravelFairie
Reviews.Content: We have visited Singapore numerous times and have stayed in a number of hotels - but from now on I think we will stick with the Regent. Despite not having the fresh glossiness of some of the more modern hotels - it is comfortable and well situated and most importantly the staff are very strong on customer service - something that we've so often found lacking in Singapore hotels. My only small quibble being that even on the Club Floor - the internet access in the room is extra. True it is provided free in the Club Lounge - but if Starbucks can give free access for the price of a coffee - when you look at the price of a room it seems remarkable that the internet should be an additional charge. But special mention must go to Mazlina, the Guest Services Manager - for really going the extra mile on our behalf to obtain tickets to Universal Studios - displaying the kind of exemplary postive, friendly and helpful attitude that will ensure that we return to this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but pricey and not a central location”
Reviews.Author: pudsontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as a stopover back from Oz. As it is some way from the nearest MTR we got a taxi to and from the airport but as it was only around S$25 it wasn't expensive. We had booked a twin/double and had emailed them to specifically request a double. But when we checked in they only had a twin, so they changed the room after the first night. The Regent is typical of many - a fantastic, sumptuous entrance, reception and restaurant area and then a bit more basic when you go up to the rooms. The rooms we had were ok, nothing special but had very comfortable beds. Breakfast was very good with the biggest choice of European, American and Asian options we had ever seen! It is located right at the top end of Orchard Road and it is a fair walk to get to the shopping (10 mins) and the MTR (15 mins). Maybe next time we will take the taxi more often. One good thing was the hotel let us freshen up before our late flight in the gym changing area which was very comfortable. Go for the room with breakfast package option as meals and drinks are pricey. As we were waiting to go back to the airport we had a cocktail and a bottle of beer - £22. Phew! As a Four Seasons, it has many of the qualities you would expect and customer service which is friendly, helpful and always with a smile. One tip for you - if you want the best foot massage ever, go to Bath Culture in Temple St in Chinatown. As recommended elsewhere on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Gillyk65
Reviews.Content: Stayed five days in this beautiful hotel and was overwhelmed by the beautiful decor and Christmas decorations.Very comfortable beds although the air conditioning was a little fierce. Nothing was too much trouble for the very helpful and professional staff and the breakfast buffet was amazing. Free WiFi would have been the icing on the cake. Thoroughly recommend to anyone on a stopover as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: malebolge42
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and quiet. The service rendered is also top-notch, both at the reception and at Basilico, where we had breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quality always top notch!”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Besides a few minor signs of aging at this hotel, it's still as clean and comfortable as the days I used to visit it when it was the Intercontinental Hotel years ago. The staff are friendly, courteous, and professional and always make you feel welcome. The pool was a little small for a 5 star hotel, but there wasn't much sun during my stay anyway. The gym is well equipped and you can get a basic yet decent work out there. I only managed to try one of the hotel's restaurants, the Tenshin Tempura Japanese restaurant. The food was good...not great...but honestly a bit overpriced as I spent $100 on my dinner there, and I was still hungry after. Good thing there's a really nice bakery downstairs at the lobby level, and a food court at the mall just next door....easily accessible by a side door and just across the walkway. I agree with other reviewers about not getting complimentary internet as most other hotels I've stayed at have it for free. But then again, S$15 for the day is not so bad really. Just one important note however. If you decide to log on to your phone as well as your laptop, this is considered separate payments even though it's on the same room account. The hotel should make this clear to their guests or else you end up paying double.....or more.... depending on the number of devices you've logged on to the same account. I explained this to the front desk and told them that I only logged on to my phone for only a few seconds and then switched to my laptop for regular use, and they happily removed the second charge from my bill on check out. The only other small inconvenience about this hotel is the location. The closest MRT is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Orchard Rd. Station. I guess I've been spoiled by having stayed at other hotels where the MRT station was literally at my doorstep. Otherwise, this is an excellent hotel. Close enough to Orchard Road, but not right in the hustle and bustle, quiet yet convenient enough to shopping and restaurants everywhere. I really needed peace and quiet to catch up on some sleep, and I slept like a baby at this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel close to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Aussi
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel close to Orchard road , good for shopaholics. Beautiful foyer with Orchids and attentive staff. No free internet although that may vary with price paid for room. In a hotel of this quality and price it should be standard, Ibis offer it it many parts of Europe and they are a budget hotel chain! Great pool and surrounds to relax in quiet as we had no noisy children/families in this style of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SMG2009
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Regent was really enjoyable. It's within an easy walk of Orchard Road and public transport. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful too. The l'Occitane bathroom products were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket hotel with nice view”
Reviews.Author: Randburg
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with The Regent and Singapore as a whole. The hotel is situated within walking distance to Orchard Road and the train station over there. The public transport system in Singapore is very effective so it does not really matter where you stay as trains, taxis,etc will get you close to anything very easily. We only stayed one night, but will use this hotel again in future as the rooms were very quiet and comfortable and breakfast was more than adequate. Staff are friendly and proud of their country. Singapore is really an amazing country for someone who hails from the developing world and shows what can be done in a relatively short space in time if your government is effective.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms, very friendly staff- very airy and bright. wonderful”
Reviews.Author: deepakvasdev
Reviews.Content: The Regent is in the heart of Singapore and yet in a quiet zone.The Traders Hotel and St Regis are on either side. Have stayed there numeorous times and the service is Consistently good. The concierge service is amongst the best in the Hotels in Singapore. Reception - efficient staff and very helpful. I had requested a hard bed in advance , they had arranged the same. The Check in was quick. Room- I had requested a garden facing room - the request was adhered to. The rooms are large. The toiletries are good quality. The TV channels are adequate with HBO, star sports, espn, bbc- etc. The standard kettle and a reasonably well stocked Mini bar. Internet was O K. Restaurants- The buffet breakfast is impressive with a good choice on the Meats, Breads and Fruits. Idli's were available and so was good Ham.The staff is what makes the difference- they are the an asset to the Hotel ! A good way to the start the day. The Italian food is good at the Basilico. Previously I think Iggy's there used to be here- but the Italian food makes up for it. Concierge- Amongst the best I have seen. Each visit they establish that they are very good. Informative and yet discrete. The Hotel has a nice place to meet visitors at the lounge on the ground level - Tea and coffee service is more then adequate. The pastries from the Bakery were average . The hotel does have a well stocked bar but not many locals seemed to be present. The Hotel is a delight to stay at - terrific service. At Singapore Dollars 250- + taxes inclusive of breakfast it was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: glenaToronto
Reviews.Content: I just came back from spending five nights at the Regent Sinapore. If you have any interest in Orchard Road then it is hard to fault the location - it is at one end of this shopping mall heaven, but it is a little quieter and relaxed compared to hotels located right on the main part of the strip. Hotel services were extremely well maintained and the service was excellent. I liked the fact that the rooms were serviced twice a day with a morning cleaning and evening turn-down services. The room was pleasant - not really five stars (no balcony, very little information on the hotel was available in the room - for example I had to ask around to learn anything about the pool, etc.) but a solid four with nice beds, decent satelite television channels, and a very nice bathroom. The gym was well-equipped and I enjoyed the round outdoor pool. The only meal I had at the hotel was breakfast. The buffet breakfast is offered in the restaurant on the second floor and it has a large variety of options. Once again, the service was excellent and the restaurant is pleasant and relaxing. The only downside was that it was quite expensive - $47 (Singapore dollars) for breakfast was hard to justify. Overall - a good hotel but I did not have a sense that I was receiving value for money. I cannot fault the hotel for its services, but I will probably look for a less expensive hotel next time I go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, ideal location, excellent staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbdotraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Regent 9/8-9/12, we had an absolute great stay. We really enjoyed the attentiveness of the staff. Particularly Josh and Teddy at the concierge desk. They went out of their way to attend to our needs and questions. I highly recommend speaking to them and taking advantage of their knowledge and expertise of the local flavor. The rooms we very clean and spacious (for Asia). The room is attended to twice a day, in the morning to clean it and in the late afternoon for evening turn down. The Breakfast was included in our room rate. It was at the Basilico restaurant and was splendid. It is a international buffet not to be missed. This hotel is located at the end of the shopping district of Orchard Road. It is actually off of Tanglin Rd. which becomes Orchard Rd. It was a 10-15 minute walk to the ION mall (Orchard & Scotts Rd.) We liked the fact that it was not in the middle of the chaos of Orchard. it was peaceful. It is also a short walk 15 minute walk to the Botanical Gardens. The Regent is right next door to the Tanglin Mall which has a very nice market (grocery store) in he basement. Also in the basement is a foodcourt that serves very good inexpensive food. In this mall there are also a few spa's. My wife and I had massages at Mt. Sapola, it was more reasonable that the spa at the hotel. My wife had a pedicure at a place in this same mall, I do not recall the name but it was very good. Overall the location and services of The Regent were great and we would consider staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Exec_chef_HL
Reviews.Content: After staying in Singapore many times while on shopping trips (i live in Bali), i was recommended this hotel by the company i work for (i work in 5 star boutique hotel). The service has to be some of the best service in Singapore. The staff are very friendly from check-in to check-out in all areas of the hotel. The rooms are clean, and well maintained. Reasonably close to the large malls and shopping areas, but taxis are readily available with help from the concierge. All in all, I have only praise for a very well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: BandonAddict
Reviews.Content: The Good: Service at The Regent is AMAZING! The concierge, Teddy, and the hostess at The Regent Club, Teriza, went above and beyond to accommodate my requests. AM & PM Housekeeping: every night, a turndown service removed the excess pillows from the bed and prepared the room for sleeping, a very nice touch. A nice Regent Club perk: free same-day pressing for shirts, slacks, & suits. This came in handy to keep my clothes in good shape. The Bad: The price seemed really high at ~SGD$400/night after service charge + GST. Many of the other 5-star hotels on Orchard have rates under SGD$300. I was told the internet service provider had changed during my stay. I noticed that the connection was sluggish during the latter half of my stay. Located on the northwester end of Orchard Rd. there aren't many shops/restaurants close by. Ion/Wisma/Taka malls are a few blocks walking. The Ugly: I was on a business trip, so I stayed for 20 days at The Regent. The laundry bill was really expensive. A pair of socks cost $5 to launder...OUCH! Unfortunately, there weren't laundry services nearby that were open during the hours when I wasn't at work, so I had no choice but to use the hotel service. The food court in Tanglin Mall (next door to The Regent) doesn't have much in the way of quality food.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Nadia
Reviews.Content: we were very impressed by the quality of service, both at the reception desk, the room and the resturaunt. we arrived very early in the morning and they very quickly made a room ready at no extra charge. breakfast was an amazing experience with such a huge variety of food from around the world and very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, room, staff, food. Best hotel to date!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffers65
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August we arrived as a family of 2 adults and 2 children anged 6 and 4. We were met with a warm and efficient welcome, we were quickly checked in and shown to our room. We had a one bedroomed suite which was just fabulous, it was very big, clean and comfortable. What I particularly loved was the generous quantities of L'Ocitaine products we were spoilt with in the fabulous bathroom. The hotel iteself is well decorated and smells beautiful...a strong scent of fresh flowers greets you every time in the shiny reception lobby. The breakfast was good with a really good selection of various foods from all over the world, the service is in the restaurant was also very good. The pool was very nice and was generally very quiet when the children used it, every time we sat by the pool the attendant would provide us with clean towels, cold flannels to cool off, fresh water and frech fruit to snack on, nothing was ever forgotten it was just great service all the way. My husband regularly used the hotel gym which he found well equipped and normally fairly quiet. Concierge services were helpful and knowledgeable and helped us to chose some interesting places to visit. We used room service and found the food and service very good. All in all we had a very good time and enjoed staying in the hotel very much, we travel regularly and are fussy however we cannot fault this fabulous and friendly hotel. Thank you Regent keep it up! It really is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deboeck
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days. Superb hotel. Bedrooms and bathrooms great. Restaurant wonderful. In particular the hotel architecture is fantastic. The atrium creates a light airy space. All rooms look out across thsi space. Its also only 10 minutes walk from Orchard Road

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cajithk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is the USP, being close to Orchard road. So it is close to most popular places. The service is good, the food is pretty good and overall, it is a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: Redjazz68
Reviews.Content: Located at the top end of Orchard Road, about 3 blocks back, an easy walk. It is also just behind Tanglin Mall, walking distance to Gleneagles Hospital. Had a club room, very spacious and comfortable. L’Occitane products in the bathroom. Club lounge is very good, excellent staff and service. Breakfast very good. Evening snacks and drinks were great. Staff always greeted me by name, and enquired after my husband who was in hospital at the time. After his discharge, one of the girls remembered it was his birthday and organised a small birthday cake for him. It was a lovely touch and to me, an outstanding example of customer service from such a large hotel. Free WiFi in the club lounge but not in the club rooms. A lot of hotels do this and I just don’t get it. Only disappointment was a room service pizza which was unequivocally the worst pizza I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: ryanb86
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a Suite free of charge because we looked tired after our flight. The room was superior. Very clean, air con was quiet and room was spotless. The staff were so friendly and were more than happy to help us around the place. Breakfast was more than 5 star with quality food. I would difinately recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful & comfortable stay with excellent guest relations and service”
Reviews.Author: vbs710
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Regent Singapore was a delight from the moment we arrived at check-in. We were booked for 4N//5D and the Front Desk representative was friendly, efficient, and cheerful. She immediately offered a late check-out, as soon as she found out we had an early evening return flight. The hotel is old but very well kept. At least, the bedrooms were renovated to a more current style and was furnished with a 40" sony bravia. The bed is large and very comfortable complete with down pillows & covers. The bathroom was quite small and dated. The location of the toilet paper was a little incovenient. but I absolutely loved the complimentary L'Occitane toiletries! It was a little strange not finding any comp toothbrush, paste, and razors. But we didn't mind as we always brought our own. Housekeeping was a pleasant and welcome surprise with a daily cleaning and turning down of our bed. We even had a fresh change of towels everyday. In the past, other hotels would limit this every other day or if you request it. The fitness center is located in the 2/F and is a wee bit tiny. Trainers are friendly and once you register, they give you a towel, earphones for the tv, and direct you to the beverage station where you can help yourself with complimentary chilled powerdrinks, coffee/tea, and a water station. Breakfast was excellent! We were courteously greeted every morning with a relaxing smile, even if the restaurant was teeming with people. Upon seating, we were given a choice of our own pot of coffee or tea and offered orange juice to start. The breakfast spread was large and had a variety of Asian & Western dishes. The cold station was located in the center serving an assortment of juices,milk, fruits in season, salads, cheese, and breakfast cereals. The bread station offered varied types of bread with different types of spreads (butter, margarine, cheeses), cold cuts, and hot pancakes/French toast and the like. The cooking stations had a daily ham carving & sausages. Eggs cooked were cooked to order in any style you want; as well, as the noodle soups were finished to order. Regular breakfast fare were 3 kinds of dimsum, daily change of breakfast potatoes, beans, breakfast sausages, miso soup, congee, daily change of delicious Peranakan dishes, etc. There were also a few regular Japanese dishes spread on the table. The dining staff was very professional and efficient--quickly clearing plates, re-setting, and always wearing a smile. They were friendly without being overly familiar. My husband and I celebrated my birthday with a wonderful lunch over at Iggy's. The 4-course lunch was superb and service was impeccable. You feel very special when dining in close quarters enough to feel a strange intimacy with those around you, yet still feel private. Despite it's fine dining service, smart casual is an acceptable attire. Next time I go back to Iggy's, I'll make sure to try their 9-course dinner. The Regent is a short walk to Orchard Road but my husband and I chose to take a taxi whenever we left the hotel. The doorman is very helpful, cheerful, and quite funny. Tips are frowned upon in Singapore and is considered an insult. If there was a time I'd generously tip hotel staff, it would be in this hotel. Guest relations and service were excellent! Concierge was very helpful providing maps, schedules of church services, and suggestions on what was the best way to go around. We were even warned of "unusual crowds" in certain areas, due to the National Day rehearsals. When we asked when National Day was, she beamed and politely answered that it was a whole month away. We absolutely loved every minute of our stay! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Better than 5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: LMV003
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending an OUTSTANDING week in Singapore staying at the Regent hotel. The hotel is out of this world and it most definitely exceeds its 5 star rating. The staff were the most friendliest, polite people who were willing and able to help in any way possible to make sure we were 100% satisfied with our stay. The location of the hotel was great. It was nice to be only a short stroll away from Orchard road for shopping and restaurants etc and a quick, cheap taxi ride to the central city areas. The variety and quality of food at the buffet breakfast were out of this world! It was so fresh and clean and the service was amazing. Our room was luxurious, very spacious and comfortable and it was cleaned immaculately twice a day. Lovely L’occitane toiletries were provided each day which were a nice touch. We attended the High Tea buffet one of the afternoons and we were blown away by the variety of savoury and sweet foods that were on offer. Not only was the presentation of the food top quality but the taste of each and every dish was delicious. We also ate at Iggy’s (rated as Asia’s second best restaurant 2010) while staying at the Regent and it was spectacular. We have eaten at several other highly rated, award winning restaurants and this surpassed all others. Certainly a must do while staying at the regent. Overall our experience while staying at the Regent was even better than expected. A truly unforgettable experience while staying in Singapore and we will definitely be returning in the not too distant future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Waji
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks magnificent from outside and it is in an excellent location near the popular Orchard Road. We were expecting our room to be Five Stars but we were disappointed to see old fashion furnishings in a medium sized room which smelled of humidity and stuffiness. My husband has asthma and had difficulties breathing in the room as you cannot open the windows. After talking to the receptionist and paying more money we were given a larger and better smelling suite with a balcony. Apart from the initial disappointment and extra cost, the rest of the hotel is beautiful. The buffet breakfast was excellent and had many varieties of local, asian and continental food. I just think that if we are paying for a five star hotel, the quality and size of the rooms should match the stars of the hotel. Maybe I am expecting too much!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, stones throw from Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Aus9
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Regent - the hotel is in the middle of an upmarket residential locality in Singapore and just off the main Orchard road - a 10 minutes walk to main shopping area. The service at the Regent was outstanding (in line with the Four Seasons Standards) and the room was very comfortable and spacious. One of the evenings we reached the restaurants just after the closing time and since we were not keen on eating in our room, the F&B manager offerred to set up a table for us at the bar so we could still order off the room service menu.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKVikram
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, walking distance to Orchard road. The service was very good but on the whole the hotel seems old. The rooms need renovation. The breakfast was excellent especially the variety offered and the quality of the food and service was very good. The swimming pool area but a bit of a disappointment as such.

Reviews.Title: “the safe is not safe!”
Reviews.Author: AlbyToby
Reviews.Content: I locked some money in a brown envelope in the room safe the night I arrived (we stayed at a deluxe room). On the third day when I took the money to the bank to exchange into SGD, the teller told me I lost 30 notes!!! I notified the hotel and called the police. The hotel arranged the police to see me in my room, but other than that, I received no help or updates from the hotel. Indeed very disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pwulantary
Reviews.Content: I was stay in this hotel for 4 night for a business trip. I could say that the hotel is one of the best hotel I've ever had. It is a luxurious hotel, might be not suitable with a budget traveling mode. I found it too spacious for a single person to stay. The funny thing is, although I'm alone they still gave me twin-bed room, with a medium size bed for each! Free newspaper in the morning, great bathroom with great toiletries (branded shampoo, etc), great buffet breakfast at the restaurant, great services, and the best thing is the great location. It's just right behind Tanglin Mall or 15 minutes to the crowdy Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and beautiful hotel, room could be better”
Reviews.Author: FranceMartine
Reviews.Content: excellent service and beautiful hotel. Our first room was disappointing. For a little extra we had a beautiful and very luxurious suite. A big difference! Pool area could be cleaner. Service pool incredible! Everything else worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: PointRed
Reviews.Content: Must stay ... Nearby Market.( Orchard Road). Many hotels and Pubs around if you dont want to be in Hotel all the time. Nightlife is really goood as many pubs are around...Hotel staff and at least it was a comfortable stay after the all day meetings and conferneces.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge in the World ... Proven”
Reviews.Author: DubaiSara
Reviews.Content: I was checking for a hotel to stay for our holiday in Singapore this coming July 2010 . We are choosing hotels and services through Tripadvisor reviews . I have a review that was long time due but it is woth to be mentioned . We are family from Dubai . Stayed at Regent Hotel Singapore with my 2 young children many years ago . It was a class hotel . The reviews that you have red about Regent Singapore rare genuine . The buffet breakfast is excellent , Very wide selection . During our stay breakfast are consist oi Japanase , Malay , Chinese , Singaporean and loads breads and cold cuts . American breakfast is also available . They even have salmon for breakfast . The best Concierge in the World I is from The Regent Hotel Singapore .Why ?????Their service and their dedication to serve the guest has no limit ... in every posibble and impossible way they have solutions . My husband lost his new mobile phone during our Night Safari trip . Staff at Night Safari tram found it and confirmed that it was submitted to the lost and found section . She even mentioned the color and model of the phone .Afetr invertigation and amid searching , Lost and Found section and the other staff denied any phone being found .It was not even logged in teh book . As a foreigner on holiday in Singapore we did not argue though the staff on the Night Safari train insisted on reporting it to the top management . I was sad that I couldnt sleep that night because I had very high regard of Singapore . I just mentioned by phone that night to the Concierge that my husband had lost his mobile phone during our night safari trip . He called the Night Safari Zoo. After 2 days we were awaken by the call that the staff of the night Safari is in Regent Hotel . They brought back the phone with lots of Night Safari souvenirs T shirts , books and key chains . They even refund our ticket fees and gave us a free tickets to the Singapore Zoo. I knew this only happened because of the intervention of the Regent Hotel Concierge .They really care . Thank you to the Concierge and Staff of Regent Hotel Singapore .You are always in our thoughts in the most special way . Our family with my 2 teenage sons and small daughter will be coming to Singapore this July 2010 and planning to stay at Fairmont or the Regent Hotel Singapore .See you again .

Reviews.Title: “nice balcony suite”
Reviews.Author: nottyandnice
Reviews.Content: Shame that the construction next door was a nightmare but nothing else to fault about this hotel. Amazing little bake shop on the ground floor,open all day, must try... Speedy and early check- in was a bonus, staff were v accomodating. Rooms were well cleaned and ready to receive guests even early in the morning. Room service was quick and efficient. will gladly stay again and recommend to medium range budget guests who want a good place in a good ;location in the Orchard belt. This property managed by the Four Seasons group might be where the difference lies.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money at this luxury property!”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel The Regent! I could see it is managed by Four Seasons, because the service was attentive and personalized. Still, not on par with a real Four Seasons, and the room, though very nice, was less than perfect. I booked a superior room, the cheapest one to be clear, through a deal online that included breakfast. The room was nice, I liked the chinese-styled cupboard that housed minibar and tv set, still I have some issues to raise: the bathroom is WAY too small for any 5 stars hotel; the a/c system leaked water. All in all, though, a very nicely appointed room that left me and my wife satisfied, and the bed assures you a nice rest and deep sleep. We had breakfast at the Basilico Restaurant. The spread for the buffet was good and covered local and international food - with a dedicated Japanese station. Service was good (even though we waited for our tea 15 minutes!) and cordial, quality of the food superior. The hotel is atrium-style, and the views you can get from the elevator while going up are breathtaking. Also, the hotel is landscaped much more nicely that the Oriental (always in Singapore)! The gym was ok, small in size but well equipped, steam room and sauna in the locker room (an oddity: no male/female separation for the sauna). The pool is not big but nicely set, and here the service is top notch, with nice sunbeds and free water/fruit/cold towels provided. Check-in and check-out were easy and fast. Another small oddity: when I arrived with the taxi I was greeted by a door...woman! She tried (the poor girl!) to take care of my suitcase, but it was way too heavy for her to lift! :) Another small oddity. All in all though, we enjoyed our stay thoroughly and would recommend this place wholeheartedly, especially given the good rates you can easily find online. Also, location-wise the hotel is literally steps from Orchard roads and the myriad of malls you can find there, and it is also walking distance from the superb botanic gardens. Rating: B + +

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and very family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: MsJetset
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 12 days in mid February in a deluxe room with breakfast. We were travelling with our two year old child and the hotel provided a cot and baby toiletries (even a robe!) all for free. Breakfast for our child was free too. The buffet breakfast is served in their Italian restaurant with Chinese, Japanese and Malay dishes as well as the standard continental and full American dishes-eggs are cooked to order. The staff were all very friendly and very accommodating - always went the extra mile to help. The only thing I would add is that if you have any requests for the concierge,it is better to pop down to the lobby in person or on your way out rather than to phone them as the phone lines always seem to be busy. The pool and shower facilities were top class. There is a kids'club every Sunday at their Italian restaurant which is very well run (with a bouncy castle and other games!) as well as a lavish afternoon tea at weekends where you can get macaroons with your name written on them! Overall, very fun for families with very young children and older kids too. The tea making facilities in the room are also a bonus if you have children. Tanglin Mall next door has lots of shops for children and families, plus a lavish supermarket and many restaurants. The Traders Hotel next door also has a great cafe restaurant which caters well to families. Taxis are easy to obtain at the front entrance - just speak to the friendly and helpful doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault it for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ciarasmummy
Reviews.Content: We were able to book the Regent incl Breakfast at very good value through Airmiles and were delighted with it all round. The room was spacious and clean, lovely L'Occitane tioletries provided. Service was great - we arrived very early - well before 11am and we were delighted that one of our rooms was already available. The other was open to us by 1pm and they were really happy to accomodate us. Everything I asked for on room service/housekeeping came v quickly and with a smile - fresh milk, extra lined to make a bed up for our daughter, addtional towels, more moisteriser were all no problem! We loved the pool, the staff here were particulalry accomodating running around getting towels, moving beds into the sun and keeping us topped up with ice water, cold flannels and spritzers. Breakfast was also fantastic, lots of chouce and again the staff here was fantastic, very accomodating and patient. We all ate very well! I would recomend the 'Something to Go' Deli, we used this alot when we wanted an economical snack (Singapore can eat into your bank balance very quickly!) and we also treated ourselves to the afternoon tea, excellent value at $42 but allow enough time, we had only 2 hours and it was only just long enough. All in all a brilliant experience and I would definitely stay here again. It is not the newest most modern hotel in Singapore by a long shot but it was was charming and grand, adn the service was superb.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1142
Reviews.Content: The Regent Singapore is certainly one of those hotels which I will continue to use as a benchmark whenever I visit another hotel. Whilst I have been lucky enough to stay at some very fine hotels, this one is right at the top of the list. I totally agree with the other reviewers who said the breakfast buffet is second to none. You really could stay in the restaurant all day eating. It’s outstanding and the service is equally as good. Rooms are also very nice and the maid service is exceptional. Whilst many hotels will service your room during the day and turn down your bed at night, what the Regent offers is two complete housekeeping services including bed turn down every day. In fact this pretty much sums up the hotel. From the lobby to the restaurants to the bathroom products and even to the elevators, the place is very opulent and almost over the top classy! I had read that the Regent is a little far away from all the ‘action’ however I actually think this is one of its positives. Anyway, In reality, it’s only a 5-10 minute walk to the centre of Orchid Road or a $6 or $7 SGD taxi ride to everywhere else. Staff are what you would expect in a top 5 star hotel – very professional and friendly. Whilst there are many fine hotels in Singapore this one impressed me very much and I will be back for sure. p.s I would also highly recommend doing the Singapore river cruise at night – Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyIndia
Reviews.Content: Regent hotel is located centrally (a short walk from orchard road), rooms are big, bath is big and luxurious. The breakfast is excellent. Could not find anything to complain of.

Reviews.Title: “All those little touches that make it shine”
Reviews.Author: DarwinAvidTraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Regent on our stopover in Singapore. Amazing breakfast, Loccitaine products in the bathroom and excellent value. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “loved to stay”
Reviews.Author: pooja310
Reviews.Content: the rooms were exelent,rooms were well fernished, 100% cotton oversized bath towels were given,100% wool blankets,Hairdryer In-room safe Private stocked bar/refrigerator Complimentary bath amenities ,wi-fi internet access, Twice daily housekeeping service which really impressed me alot,facilities include a gymnasium with TV , Full-time fitness instructors are available to assist with individual workout programmes.food was really good

Reviews.Title: “Great value, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpratt2452
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Singapore for 10 days at the Regent. Very quiet rooms, good service. Would stay at the Regent again

Reviews.Title: “Certainly no Four Seasons, but one amazing breakfast!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kingmike
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the rate for the rooms, really nothing special at all. Nice amenities in the room. toiletries- tea, etc. BUT the breakfast the Basilico WAS THE BEST! Food from all four corners of the globe. You could leave there full for the ENTIRE day! Note for the low service score: Arriving at 1:30 am, the Front desk staff checked me into a smoking room that reeked with smoke- When I went back down and asked for a non-smoking room, she first asked me to stay in that room just for one night, when I refused she put me into a tiny room with a twin bed. When I returned to the desk for the 3rd time, I was given a satisfactory room. Really?! This is Four Season's service?

Reviews.Title: “Here is a five star tick for Regent !”
Reviews.Author: js2003au
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived travel weary and with a baggage missing from the airport shuttle. We were made to feel very welcome right from the doormen to all the other staff who greeted (and reassured) us all the way through. In my various stays in the numerous hotels around the world, never have I noticed such personal warmth and care from the front line staff in any hotel. The concierge made all the right phone calls and traced our bag in a short time, The reception staff allowed us to check in earlier than the usual check-in time. Room service was impeccable and the hotel quite opulent. We got this centrally located hotel (took me just under three minutes to walk to Orchard Rd) under the Singapore Airlines Stopover Holiday package (with which came a whole lot of other freebies incl 40 dollars of shopping vouchers at the airport). So in essence, I feel that we got the stay at the Regent for practically a few dollars ! Regent is a fantastic hotel which is centrally located (and I am usually a tough marker). We had breakfast at the Basilico Restaurant which is on the first floor of the hotel- comfy seating and tasty food. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay close to Orchard Road and who wants value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with amazing facilities”
Reviews.Author: TravelBerto
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and clean with great service from all of the staff. The rooms are huge with large bathrooms and luxurious beds. The gym and swimming pool is superb and the food is amazing, especially for breakfast. Try to book early so that you can get a good deal with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: map44
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 day stop over in Singapore on our way to Thailand. Regent is an excellent hotel we had a Club Room which was large and plenty of room for the four of us. This rate included the Regent Club on the 11th Floor which was just fantastic. The staff were amazing, the food was delicious and our stay was memorable. The location is good its a little walk but good for the heart after all that eating. Highly recommend the Regent the staff just make the place fantastic. Thank you for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great for the rate”
Reviews.Author: boxfan88
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel is a bit past its prime- but what it lacks in facilities, it makes up for in other ways. Pros: Away from all the chaos of the city in a quiet neighborhood, great breakfast brunch, outstanding staff at every point. Also, breakfast was included in our rate, but since our plane was so early they gave us the value towards room service that day- now that is impressive. Cons: Poor security, old and somewhat dirty corridors, the plumbing was extremely noisy- to the point you could not hear the tv or talk over the shower, old TVs, not near the MRT station by any means. Overall, I would say that with Four Seasons taking over and renovations coming, hopefully this hotel will just get better and better.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: happykiwitauranga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Regent for two nights on our way to London and back This included the Singapore Stopover which was really good value. What a wonderful place to stay. We could have just stayed in the hotel without going anywhere else. The staff were wonderful. Service was really good. Rooms were good. Beds were really comfortable Try the High Tea..something to remember. I had my birthday there and the staff gave me a special cake in the room and at High Tea they brought in a birthday cake and the wait staff sang happy birthday..so it was very special. We would definitely stay at the Regent next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel and meetings in hotel”
Reviews.Author: tourismspecialist88
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in the Regent in August. I found a decent rate that included internet and bkfast, making the rate quite attractive by Singapore standards. I found the hotel to be just fine, comfortable room (a bit dated), respectable internet connection, good breakfasts. In short, no major shortcomings, but not top-notch, either. A big plus is that I had to host a number of meetings with colleagues and others, and there are lots of places around the lobby and on the first two floors to be able to meet in small groups. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, nice hotel, great service, decor dated”
Reviews.Author: jamesy168
Reviews.Content: The room was large with an outdoor terrace. The staff were very helpful, ther bed comfortable and flat screen tv. internet access is fee based S$12 for 1 hr!! The decor is probably 10 years + but in resonable condition. It looks like the hotel was deisgned by John Portman with its big internal atrium, only problem was sound from the lobby bar drifting up into the room late at night

Reviews.Title: “Way past its glory days”
Reviews.Author: ZhengHeAsia
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from my room in the Regent Singapore. Couldn't sleep because the non-smoking room smelled like a cigar bar, due to the excessive smoke coming through the A/C vent. So my choice is either let smoke pump through the room, or withstand the heat of Singapore by turning the A/C off. The hotel 20 years ago must have been great. The lobby still looks that way. But the rooms are quite dated. Looks like it hadn't been updated in a long time. Location is nice. Restaurants in the hotel very good, and famous in Singapore. However the Internet didn't work for 1/2 day. Service is nonchalant. Requested my favorite newspaper upon check-in. Did not get it in the morning. Called concierge and waited for 20 minutes and still did not get it. Finally had to leave the room. Not what a 5-star should be. I probably would have stayed here again if not for the smoke issue. Probably nothing the hotel can do considering the crumbling infrastructure. So many hotel choices in Singapore now and every hotel has lowered its rates drastically. So choices abound. Shame. A faded grand dame.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel but not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: sc009
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Regent for a only a couple of days. Learned on arrival that only one of our rooms were ready but were told all was good after 2 hours. This wasn't so. Had to change rooms again to a lower floor! Meanwhile our luggage took an age to get up there. The drainage in the bathroom was poor and we could hear rumbling water pipes whenever people were using them. Upon checkout, front desk mistakenly billed us for the mini bar which we didn't even use. Staff was friendly however too unorganised and inefficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around experience”
Reviews.Author: corbin08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Regent with a colleague for 8 nights on business. Great hotel to escape the grind of a work day. Had a suite on the Club Floor which was perfect. Free Cocktails, wireless and light snacks were perfect on nights when we didn't feel up to going out. The entire staff from bellman to club level attendant was delightful. One lady even offered to go to the grocery store for a sauce I liked for my trip home. Have read where the bathrooms are a little small, which is true, but they are clean, modern and fine. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was my favorite...has a really nice anti-pasta buffet. Discovered the spa, steam room and whrilpool on my last day - wish I had been there everyday. The gym is well equipped. Hotel is a short walk to so much shopping and restaurants as well as the Botianical Gardens. Would be a nice place to run if you have some time. I heard many say the hotel was old and I am sure there are newer hotels in the area, but I didn't find anythign wrong with The Regent. Perfect room, wonderful staff, great food. Just what I needed on a 10 day trip away from home. I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy , old world charm”
Reviews.Author: hedgefund007
Reviews.Content: The Regent has to be one of the top hotels in Singapore . It is luxurious and in an old world way , so makes for a very elegant hotel . It is well located , at one end of Orchard Road so one can walk to all the shopping . We did not eat in so can't comment on that but am sure they will not be lacking in that department . The swimming pool area could do with some renovations . Must confess that we may be a bit biased because we got upgraded to a suite .

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times; we recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: nagiffag
Reviews.Content: This is one of our corporate-approved hotels in Singapore so we've stayed here many times, most recently for a week in February with our toddler. Love 'Something to Go' cafe (?) although they sometimes run out of something I wanted. I didn't have the breakfast buffet in Capers this time, but have enjoyed it in the past although I find it overpriced. There's a well-rated restaurant there too, but I can't recall the name. Location is decent - almost next to Tanglin Mall, close to end of Orchard and walking distance to Botanical Gardens. Parking is included. Rooms are a decent size, which is an important consideration when in Singapore. Staff is nice, especially the doormen who are very helpful and even remembered us. Outdoor pool is nice and they even offered us (free) fruit and water. The biggest negative is they clean your room when you have the Do Not Disturb on, but you can ask them to put 'Do Not Clean when DND light is on' in your room info. We'll stay there again when in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 nite stopover for 50 yr old solo female traveller”
Reviews.Author: JulesMlbourne
Reviews.Content: Stopover on the way back from London to Melb. - Booked Singapore Airlines fabulous stop over package at this hotel - On check in - uograded to club room for extra sin $ 60 per nite - Room on 11th floor - same as club lounge - large deluxe room with all mod cons, nice outlook and quiet room ..all good... when i checked in , I just mentioned to the porter that i thought the room smelt a bit musty,and within 5 mins. the manager of housekeeping was there to check it out, and he told me that it was just the air spray , but they would move me if i wanted ...but he was right and the room was fine .... All hotel staff were friendly, efficient and happy to do their job and go ' the extra mile ' . Staff in the club lounge went well beyond the call of duty - remembering my name, asking how they could help me plan my day, looked up where to go to get specific presents for the kids ....and helped me with my flight details and broken suitcase ..... Breakfast, snacks, drinks etc in the lounge were fresh and plentiful and constantly replenished. I did not have to get dinner as i just ate all the food in the lounge !! I also got my clothes pressed for free and free internet ..so the upgrade was worthwhile .... had lunch at the in house Italian restaurant - good food & ambience but quite expensive Pool - sparkling clean , never crowded and always got cold water, wet face towel and a cold water spritzer bottle ... Location - 5 - 10 mins walk to Orchard Road ( i got taxi - too hot ) , 2 other malls nearer ( 2-4 min walk) .... Sometimes when i travel alone, I find 5 star hotels very formal and unfriendly - this was not the case at the Regent, and I felt very special .

Reviews.Title: “Not for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Alberthanoi
Reviews.Content: If you have small children, you should select another hotel. The rooms are accessed via glass-sided air bridges with sides that are much too low. An adult carrying a child could easily topple over into the abyss, as could any adult taller than about 175cm carrying anything over waist level. A child could easily climb over and plummet. No thanks, until they raise the railings. The internet service was not very good. It cut off, it was slow, and ads kept popping up. On the positive side, the staff were quite helpful and the A/C was easy to regulate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: RRR16
Reviews.Content: We had once stayed earlier in Regent, in May 2006 , and liked the experience so much that we stayed again in Jan 2007. The hotel is just next to Orchard Road, close to the bustling street, yet quite and peaceful. The rooms are excellent, well maintained and service is good. Buffet Breakfast is good with many choices. Would like to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: raviessar
Reviews.Content: great location,expensive though,great amneties,,brand new rooms,comfortable beds

Reviews.Title: “Great location and huge suite”
Reviews.Author: trip4visor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just few block from the famous Orchard road. I booked a suite which is exactly two rooms size. Very clean and well maintained with plenty of space. I remember the room boy every day asking for more iceI don't know why. Bathrooms are not as great as the room decoration, but nothing to complain with. The lobby area has a warm atmosphere with very nice flowers decorations. Great value for money at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at The Regent”
Reviews.Author: Lily246
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two adults and 2 children aged 13 and 11) stayed at the Regent for a 3 night stopover on the way to Australia. From the moment we arrived we had a fantastic stay.. The only downside was that we arrived about 7.30am and was told our room wasn't ready but would be ready by 9am, which it was, and as the official check in wasn't till 2pm this was Ok. We sat in the very nice lobby area and were served tea and biscuits. Once we got our room key we made our way upto our room on the 6th floor. You needed a room key card to be able to go up in the lifts which I thought was a great security feature. Once in our room we thought it was fantastic. We haven;t stayed in alot of hotels so maybe we are easily pleased but it was really nice. We booked a weekend deal for an executive suite, which gave us a lounge area (with sofa bed) and bedroom with two bathroom which was great. The location was fine for us fairly near to Orchard Road. The pool area was lovely and the complimentary fruit kebabs and iced water were a nice touch. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: samtravel
Reviews.Content: In a city renowned for the standard of it's hotels there cannot be a hotel with a better service ethic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: newzealandfan
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 4 stayed in this levely hotel end of January 2009. As I wanted a good location near to Orchard road we choose The Regent. The location could not have been better. Its a 1 mintue walk to Orchard road and a very nice shopping center (Tanglin Mall) is opposite the hotel. For kids clothing try Chateau De Sable in that Mall. Excellent value! We loved everything about the hotel. The entrance and lobby is very welcoming and truly elegant. Check in was quick and the Executive Suite was great with our two small kids. We had a bedroom for the adults and a living room for the kids. Yes the room is not too modern but everything is in good quality and working perfect, no worries about that. Breakfast is excellent aswell and you can even have it outside by the pool which you wont find in so many Singapore First Class Hotels. The Pool is on the small side, but we did not want to swim a race or so in it. Its very quiet, and big enough to my point of view. The only thing i have to say is that i had a massage and it was the worst i ever had, the spa itself is already really worn out, but the old massage therapeut topped it all. I did not enjoy it a single bit. Something has to be done about that! Appart from that it was all perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: MiltonKeynesSte
Reviews.Content: We had decided to stop over in Singapore to see the New Year in with friends as we travelled out to Australia. Flying with Singapore Airlines we were able to take advantage of reduced rates through Singapore Airlines on a stop over scheme they run which includes your transfers between the airport and the hotel. The hotel is not one of the newest in Singapore but is well maintained and the service is superb. It is well situated for the 'Orchard' shopping and there are a number of good restaurants close by if you don't use the restaurant. As other reviews have mentioned the breakfast is well worth a try. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still delivering a great experience”
Reviews.Author: accidentaltourist_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for five nights on a stopover on our way to Australia. The room rate included a sumptuous buffet breakfast, for those who want it. I stayed here in 1991 for almost a month whilst house-hunting in Singapore and was interested to see if it has changed. It has not. The service standards are still superlative and the staff could not be more welcoming. The decor has not changed at all and it could be said that the hotel is slighly faded in its decor in the public areas. The pool is overlooked by the restaurant/breakfast area and is small by comparison with more modern hotels. Unfortunately the side of the Traders Hotel, now immediately adjacent to the Regent, towers over the pool too. This wasn't a big problem to us but could be off-putting. Our room and its amenities were excellent. The bed was comfortable, with softish pillows; bathroom facilities were good if a little small. The location of the hotel is convenient for Orchard Road, the Botanical Gardens and central Singapore. We would highly recommend it for its level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Blankko
Reviews.Content: The very friendly and helpful reception staff provided a positive first impression of The Regent. In fact, throughout my short stay it was difficult to fault the staff all of whom seemed to go out of their way to make my stay as trouble free and enjoyable as possible. The rooms were decorated in period style and were a bit smaller than I was expecting. The bathroom in particular was a little disppointing for this standard of hotel. However, the common areas and bars were all very welcoming and comfortable. I also found the fact it was only a short walk to the famous Orchard Road shops convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomad07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Regent for F1 Grand Prix. The hotel is clean, has an amazing buffet for breakfast with a chef on standby to prepare cooked breakfasts. Breakfast caters for all tastes, Asian, Japanese, European and general Western diets. The pool is clean, with a great gym very modern and well equipped, great spa, sauna and steam room all at no additional cost. The rooms are clean, modern, plenty of room, no LCD or plasmas however and limited TV channels. The stay was pleasent, close to Orchard Road and about 10 - 15 minutes walk to train station at Orchard. Would stay again, however very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Atong
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. All hotel personnel were very helpful and rooms clean and the staff most helpful. Being on a budget found that room service was reasonable provided you kept on to the basics and the food was excellent. The concierge were most helpful in organizing local tours and reservation to restaurants could not fault them all. The only minor difficulty we experienced was on the first day as the hot water did not come out promptly but was told to let the water drip for a few minutes before the water would come out. I organized my stay via Qantas holidays and found the rates reasonable but was told as a result my frequent flyer points would be credited, so be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at The Regent”
Reviews.Author: sambakongen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Regent for 7 nights mid August 2008. This was the first stay for me at The Regent and having heard and read many positive reviews, my expectations were high. It is an old hotel which the excellent staff however make up for. The gym and pool-area clearly shows the hotels age as they are much smaller than what newer hotels would have. The gym is claustrophobic small (but with good new machines) and the pool is located so no sunlight enters the area after 3 pm. At the pool chilled water in glasses and pieces of fruit is served when you come and more chilled water is readily available. If you stay the entire day you may be lucky to get a 2nd serving of fruit. The room (1039) was large with a king size bed. The bathroom's heavy use of brownish marble again showed the hotels' age in addition to there only being a tub and no shower cabin. The tub however was quite wide and the shower located so it was possible to stand upright under it. The TV and selection of channels was below par for a 5-star hotel. We only tried roomservice once (Sunday morning at 1 am). The service was very quick and quality of food very good. Considering the selection of other 5-star hotels in Singapore, I would not stay at The Regent again. The service is good, the staff are very friendly and efficient but when 5-star prices are charged, that is not enough

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NavvyTravel
Reviews.Content: I previously wrote the review "classy lady" several months ago and in that review, I stated that I would bring my family in July for a one week vacation. Well, I made the trip last week with the family (wife plus 3 kids [three year old twins and seven year old daughter]) and The Regent took great care of us, from the beginning to the end. We stayed in an executive suite (which has a pull out bed in the living room and a King in the bedroom) that worked out perfectly for us. We received fresh fruit each day and turn down service at night. We started each day at the breakfast buffet beside the pool. There is a great range of food, to include a different selection of noodles each day, all your breakfast food (eggs, bacon, sausage), freshly baked bread, fruits, and an asian section with fried rice, curry, etc. During the week, the concierge helped us plan visits to the zoo, night safari, sentosa island, and Clark Quay. I would suggest having them arrange a car (40 sing per hour) to take you around town, we had them take us to Clark Quay for a river ride and then over to Raffles for lunch. They will also arrange to have a car pick you up at the airport and return (not the hotel limo but a really good service in a mercedes for 60 sing). My kids loved the pool (just refurbished) and my wife and I enjoyed the service (you get served ice water/lemon with fresh fruit and a scented cold towel). We finished off our stay at the Summer Palace restaurant and had a wonderful Chinese dinner. This is truly one of the best hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect "cocoon" for a Singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this lovely hotel en route from Europe to Australia in July 2008. If you are looking for a comfortable, easy stopover experience with good access to mainstream shopping and dining options (rather than a perhaps more interesting experience in one of Singapore's more diverse ethnic enclaves like Chinatown and Little India, both of which have a good range of hotel options), this hotel is the perfect choice. Located a short walk from the malls and nightlife of Orchard Road yet in a quiet location itself, The Regent features very comfortable beds, well-appointed rooms, excellent but not snooty service from friendly and attentive (but not overbearing) staff, a small but enjoyable swimming pool and sun deck area, a pleasant bar with live jazz bands, two restaurants (one Italian, one Cantonese) and a relaxed tea lounge perfect for an afternoon respite from all that shopping at the nearby frenetic malls. The hotel is perhaps not as luxurious as some of its competitors: for instance, the bathroom is small but functional, and, as mentioned above, the pool is large enough to get wet in but that is about it, but in many ways it is this very feature which makes the hotel a more relaxed 5 star option. We enjoyed our brief stay and would happily recommend it for any weary transit traveller.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: 2TravellersAustralia
Reviews.Content: Decided to give the Regent a try after several stays at The Orchard where the service is starting to slip. Accommodation was in a Superior Room as I was only in Singapore for 1 night whilst in transit. The entry foyer (and the hotel in general) is certainly impressive, although I'm at a loss to understand why there are so many hotel staff simply standing around. Perhaps they were on a break ? In any case, check-in was straight forward and I was directed to the elevators with instructions on how to find my room. The room was clean & presentable and sufficient for my requirements, but it is showing its age by virtue of the decor & fittings etc. The bathroom was very small but large enough for 1 person. Hotel location is very good at the 'top' end of Orchard Rd. Overall, I was not disappointed in The Regent with a room tariff of SIN$290 ++ per night, but the hotel is not a 5 Star hotel. If you make a booking with a 5 Star expectation, then I think you'll be a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “CLASSY AND FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Jannecy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, must say that the trip (shuttle bus approx $7 aus) from the airport to the city must be one of the best in the world - an abundance of lush greenery and pink bouganvillias nestled amonst the clean streets. Then on through busy Orchard Road and then 5 mins away in more greenery was the beautiful Regent Hotel. I think as I walked into the elegant foyer I actually mouthed "Wow!" - just stunning as you can see. Then to the desk where the friendly, polite and welcoming team gave me my key etc. all without any delay. My room was large and relaxing - great bathroom and terrific view from my huge floor to ceiling window. Housecleaning staff also very friendly and polite. The position of the hotel is just perfect - so quite and lush yet only 5-10 min walk to Orchard Road, which I did about 3 times a day (2 day stopover). Congrats to The Regent and staff - look forward to my return!

Reviews.Title: “Just Good”
Reviews.Author: Gardengirlhotel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a nice quiet location just off Orchard Road, which gives it a relaxed quality. Staff is friendly and helpful, although housekeeping staff could not speak any english. Breakfast buffet was a joke, crammed into there tiny lounge. Omelet Chef was wiping pans with dirty cloth, very shocking. There is no all day restaurant as there is refurbishment on going. Most disappointing of the stay was food quality. But good value for money, hotel is a bit tired needs an uplift or facelift, cannot rely only on Four Seasons name to bring in customers.... Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: P&SSmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regent Hotel as part of the SIA Stopover Package. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, the staff and service were excellent. The rooms were beautifully appointed (we stayed in an executive room for 1 night and then a superior room for 6 nights). The bathroom in the executive room was more spacious than the superior room but both rooms were modern and extremely comfortable. Housekeeping were attentive and extremly efficient. We forgot to switch off the 'Do Not Disturb' sign one morning when we went out sightseeing. When we returned to the room, it had been cleaned and a note on our bed was left to say that after careful consideration and trying to contact us twice, the housekeeping department decided to freshen our room and hoped that we were not inconvenienced by this. They asked us to contact them if they had been intrusive in anyway and provide them with further instructions on maintaining the room during our stay. Breakfast was lovely but a little expensive for Singapore standards. However, this is easily remedied by walking to Orchard Road or going to Tanglin Mall (situated behind the hotel). We loved every minute of our stay at the Regent and will be definitely returning.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: snwong48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located located at the fringe of Orchard Road and is a good 15 minute walk to Ngee Ann City. Now, because it's not that near to the main shopping area, the hotel manages to retain a certain quiet and peaceful charm. In a nutshell: The GOOD 1. The staff are excellent - we did not have a single bad, rude or surly encounter with any of the staff. They were all pleasant, helpful and had a sense of humour which we enjoyed.I would say that the training must be top notch because their service is about the best I have experienced. 2. Public areas - discreet, charming and very classy The Bad 1. Rooms are tired- Its really time for a refurbishment. You can tell the age of the hotel by the room and lets just say, the hotel is not young. I like the antique looking furniture but the rooms are very tired looking 2. The gym - to tiny with not enough space between the machines 3. Breakfast - little variety and food was very so-so. I would go back to stay in a heartbeat if they refurbished the hotel as the service as fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover at the Regent”
Reviews.Author: kkeating
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Regent as part of the Singapore Stopover. The staff was very accommodating, allowing us to check-in immediately after we arrived from our long overnight flight from Amsterdam. Our room was clean and nicely appointed, although the bathroom was starting to show its age. The room was about average in size; it had a king-size bed, a dresser, a desk and a comfy sofa chair and ottoman. The bathroom was a bit small but adequate, and it had a standard bathtub/shower configuration with a large sink and mirror. The breakfast buffet served each morning was excellent, and the bar was quite nice as well. The hotel also has a highly recommended restaurant, but we did not dine there. The service at the hotel was outstanding - the front desk staff were incredibly helpful, the housekeeping staff were very thorough, and the concierge provided excellent service. The location of the hotel is ideal for shopping along Orchard Road. The Regent was very similar to the InterContinental, which we stayed at twice last year. We had hoped to stay at the InterCon again this year, but unfortunately, it's not part of the Singapore Stopover anymore. We thought that the quality of rooms (in the main tower) at the InterCon was slightly superior to that of the Regent, but the Regent offered the better breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for those who plan to do a lot of shopping on Orchard Road, and I would happily stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff but a little tired looking”
Reviews.Author: WaldoFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stopover at the Regent en route from Australia. The staff and service at the Regent cannot be faulted, but we were disappointed to hear upon our arrival that the pool was closed for renovations. Not the best news for our daughters, who were eager to swim after the flight!
