The hotel has arranged for guests to use the pool at the hotel next door, but whilst better than nothing, this was not terribly convenient. The hotel offers a quiet refuge just off busy Orchard Rd, but is showing its age and looks like it needs a rehaul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JenniferEssex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regent for a four night stopover on our way home from a holiday in Australia. From the moment we alighted our stopover shuttle bus we were welcomed with smiling staff. Our room was beautiful with the largest most comfortable king size bed we have slept in. The room service was fantastic with lovely clean crisp bed linen changed daily, plus refreshing the room twice daily. The staff were exeptional with their helpfulness and smiles at all times. The hotel was a short walk from Orchard Road which suited us perfectly. We enjoyed the peace and quiet on our return each evening to the hotel, but the convenience each day of being close to all the great shops etc. We are hoping to visit our relatives again next year and we will not consider staying anywhere other that the Regent for our stopover in Singapore on our way home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mebaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. Bed and sheets especially were nice. Breakfast was fine. Staff were also very good. The location is a bit away from the main action however (but quiet). Other than that, staying there was a super experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this experience”
Reviews.Author: vickiPerth
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore to stay at The Regent on the start of our Australian visit for a four night stopover enroute. It was a wonderful haven of peace and tranquility after a long journey from Scotland. Thankfully, after eating a great meal in one of the hotel's restaurants we slipped between crisp cotton sheets and with the hum of the airconditioner slept a deep and refreshing sleep in an incredibly comfortable double room. We were just coming in from China Town the next evening when we got a call to say my husband's mother had just died in South Africa. My husband decided to go immediately to South Africa and we decided that I would travel to Perth, Australia as previously planned. The hotel management could not do enough for us - they gave us free internet access, sent up endless trays of coffee, tea and chocolates etc, sent faxes and generally looked after us. When my husband left they took it upon themselves to look out for me too and I got wonderful, warm and compassionate treatment from not just the management but from every member of staff I came into contact with. All in the beautiful setting of the Regent hotel. I have to say they went way over their normal duty of care for their clients and we appreciated every single thing they did for us. On our return from Australia a month later we had booked to stay with them again, and found the same warmth and hospitality that we had previously experienced. The rooms are divine - cool, calming and comfortable with cable TV, lovely bathrooms and a well stocked mini bar. Each night when we were out, our rooms were freshened up, and we came back to, once more, order, calm and comfort! The hotel is immaculate with fabulous bars and restaurants and if you want to spoil yourself at a comparatively small cost, try the wonderful hotel buffet which is on every night - we couldn't fault it. The pool area is being renovated but you would not have even known that and they had reciprocal agreements with the Trader hotel next door if you needed it. The location is great, just on the corner of the famous Orchard road, two minutes from the Tanglin shopping mall where you can eat if you choose or shop, and a couple of minutes from the Singapore Airlines hop on/hop off bus stop (look up Singapore Airlines website for this great facility). Failing that, the doors were always opened by smiling, gracious staff and a taxi hailed right to your feet by obliging doormen. The Concierge facility at the hotel is great - they can answer anything! So, as you can gather, we loved The Regent and feel you could not go wrong with this choice - everything about the hotel is designed to pamper the client and they do it so well. Special thanks go to all the staff there but especially to Roslee Ashari, Assistant Front Office Manager, the lovely Afiza, Duty Manager and Jayabalan at the Tea Room restuarant, we won't forget your kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: LostAussie18
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have been around for a number of years, but it still has the feel of luxury you would expect from a Four Seasons hotel. The smiles were genuine and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. It is just the right size and the lovely atrium makes the whole building, bright and airy. Its the only place in the world where we have had staff wave at us as we went past in the glass elevator. The room was in excellent condition and a good size. The bathroom was fine, but as others have noted, not quiet as fancy or large as you now get in a 5 star hotel. The buffet breakfast was excellent and we found the Summer Palace chinese restaurant to also be excellent. The hotel is well located just a couple of blocks from Orchard Rd, but nice and quiet. We will definitely stay here again anytime we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Service with 'A SMILE' !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fartown
Reviews.Content: Recently we were very lucky to stay at the Regent Hotel in Singapore, it was my first time but my wife and friends stayed there in 2006. The quality and service remain as good as ever, also the Regent Club was again excellent and the staff so friendly. Hope to be staying here again before the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “It's in a good location for Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: pitttrader1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regent for business in 2006, and it was great for that. However, all I did was sleep and shower there. With teens it was an okay hotel. I had a lot of trouble with the internet here. I don't know if it was a hotel firewall, or the Singapore government, but it was tremendously difficult to access basic sites on the web (like Yahoo). My kids showed me a firewall work around that worked for awhile. Breakfast at Capers is good, but expensive. You can take a very short walk to a mall and get a cheap good breakfast as well. The beds could use some upgrading. The mattresses are pretty hard. They could also use better television channel selection. The staff is friendly, but the concierge doesn't really have a good grasp of what a concierge is supposed to do. Otherwise, service is good. My friends in Singapore say you can have a good stay or a bad stay. If you want a guaranteed good stay, pay a LOT more and stay at the Four Seasons or Ritz. Cabs are very cheap in Singapore-so even if you want to go to Clarke Quay or Boat Quay, you can get there cheaply and quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: fco
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed. Last time 2 years ago when we thought it very dated, this time for 3 nights over New Year in a Regency Club room. Value pretty good through a corporate rate. Furnishings are fresher and room (11th floor) of average size and smallish bathroom. Shower is in the bath and a bit of a danger for the not so nimble as no hand rail or non slip surface. Can breakfast in Club or Capers, we used both; plus free happy hour drinks 5-8, and a great plus of free pressing of clothes; as well as free access to internet. Staff service was exemplary at every level. Breakfast more than adequate in Capers (used only once) - Western, indian, Japanese, Chinese, although service chaotic and slow to refill a number of dishes but could have been a hang over of festivities. Breakfast in Club more leisurely and unrushed although selection more limited but offer of more variety re Japanese etc on a menu (no extra cost). We attended the New Year's Eve function in the bar - good music, tapas food and free bar for a reasonable S$95++. Location is a 10 minute walk to nearest MTR at Orchard Rd but a bus stop outside hotel and 1 minute from many other bus routes. Taxi prices recently increased but still very modest to get around town. Overall nice ambiance but still has a slightly dated feel but with great staff who genuinely make you feel welcome. Didn't try any other in-house restaurants. Pool (outside Capers) looked welcoming if rather small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: freebiestuff
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Regent several times using the Singapore Stopover service (3-5 nights each time) and would definitely stay again. The food in Capers is excellent, the breakfast buffet has the biggest selection of European and Asian food I've ever seen in a hotel and will set you up for the day. The evening meals are of equally good quality and the waiting staff are very friendly and appear to be very happy to explain or advise on the dishes. Personally I like the attention that the room staff give you, others seem to think that it's an imposition for the staff to come in and clean your room, change the pillows (day/night,) fold your clothes, replace your ice etc. I admit I was a bit surprised at first, but soon got used to the fact that if I turned my back for a minute, someone would sneak in and tidy up, honestly though, press do not disturb and they don't, leave it like that for a few hours and reception will phone to check you're OK, the service is that good. The pool is first class, gym is good enough and again there are staff on hand just waiting for your towel to look a bit damp so that they can change it. There seems to be a lot of high end business clients using this hotel, as well as some very wealthy looking wedding parties, good indicators of quality. Well worth the money, we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: mdore1
Reviews.Content: I "decompressed" at the Regent after a dive trip to Indonesia. The travel agent had booked us into The York. After one night in that abomination, we left and checked ourselves into the Regent. The best part of the Regent is the staff. They could not be more helpful, friendly, and accommodating. For example, our room wasn't ready when we checked in (not their fault, we arrived early in the morning), so we went into the dining area for breakfast. When the waitress gave us the check I told her we didn't have a room assigned yet so I couldn't make a room charge. The waitress repied, "Would you like me to check and see if your room is ready?" "Why, yes, please!" "I'm sorry, it's not ready yet...would you like me to show you where the business center is located? The waiting area?" Stunning. The wait staff is creative and empowered. Overall, I noticed more business travelers than tourists. That's fine with me, they can stay at the York or the Marriott along Orchard Road. The room was a bit small but Four Seasons quality. Great cigar shop, live music lounge, offers incredible shopping just blocks away, good central location. I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of my stay at the Regent. It offers small-hotel quality service and terrific I can't wait to return in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Some minor issues with service.”
Reviews.Author: Jade97
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with The Regent on their website for a "weekend" package which gave me access to The Regent Club facilities and breakfast included. When I checked in they upgraded me to a suite room. The room was very comfortable. Service at the concierge was very good. The Regent Club lounge provides free drink and cookies and a quiet space to work. I tried their Chinese cuisine restaurant and their Japanese tempura restaurant. Both were average compared to other 5 star hotel F&B establishments and could use some improvement on the food presented. The only faults I could pick: - I made a reservation at the Tea Lounge and it was not recorded. - If the Tea Lounge was full, and very often it's fully reserved during the afternoon, then there's no where else to go for a drink. - I had the room for late checkout and for some reason housekeeping insisted on cleaning our room before our checkout time. - The bill at checkout time charged me for breakfast when it was supposed to be included in the room rate due to the package I booked through. Had I not asked reception to fix it I would have had to pay for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 70s style opulence”
Reviews.Author: youngaussie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Despite this being a Four Seasons property, it is certainly not of the usual 5 stars Four Seasons standard. Got a standard room on the 7th floor and it has a very "Westin feel" to it. The hotel is very obviously somewhat dated, but the staff do a good job with upkeep and maintaing the luxury feeling somewhat. Bathroom was quite sufficient, but mostly spartan in terms of the bath products provided. The room is basic 90s style with old style hotel phone, but at least the room came with high speed internet and an ethernet plug for the laptop. TV channels weren't bad, but the TV was quite small. The free breakfast provided downstairs at Capers was great. Very international breakfast with typical eggs, pastries, and continental choices, but also dim sum/dumplings and other Asian and Indian selections. It was a huge feast., The conference facilities were actually top notch with plenty of high class and roomy meeting spaces on numerous floors. Although the hotel layout is quite awkward, the terraced layout makes for a very large feeling hotel and it seems there's lots of explore. The hotel also abounds with choices for restaurants and you can see the nice pool from the Capers restaurant dining area (maybe a little weird for swimmers). The level of service here is just okay. I was constantly interrupted by house keeping throughout the day and wish their service was a little more discreet in timing/presence. They had over 8 check-in staff at the counter, but none of them offered to show me to m room. The check-in lady also did not point out where the elevators were and assumed I had known. The bell boy was very efficient however and my suitcases came up to my room in less than 10 minutes. The conference sevice staff were very efficient and friendly. Although at times some of them seem very young and "new to the job." Finally, location is quite good. At the very end off the Orchard Road area. The new St. Regis is finishing up right across the street. I think you should stay at other hotels further down. Regent is about a 10 minute walk to the main bustling shoppping area of Orchard Road and there is certainly where Hilton, Marriott, and Hyatt beat them out. So, this isn't exactly a real Four Seasons, but it is still quite nice and a classic luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nooshie
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel throught the Singapore Stopover, which has a great selection and good prices. The Regent was well reviewed on Trip Advisor and was reputed to be more spacious than other hotels of its class. This was certainly true. Excellent bathroom. Good size room with lounge area. Good solid hotel with no noise from other rooms. Beautiful public spaces. Nice pool. Very close to shopping and botanical gardens. We have a 15 month old toddler so plenty of room for him to spread out those toys! Food excellent. Reasonable prices, recommend the buffet lunch in the cafe. Service attentive and friendly. One complaint.... Washing service ludicrously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mature opulence”
Reviews.Author: BigTaps
Reviews.Content: The original Four Seasons Hotel in Singapore. Extremely convenient for the Orchard Area without actually being amoungst that hussle and bussle. Not sure, but most probably 25 years old now, but has matured gracefully. Excellent staff, excellent facilities and the rooms are absolutely 5 star. Quality staff who are more than efficient without being intrusive. I normally stay at the Fullerton but they are pricing themselves out of the market and the level of service is going down. Whether on holiday or business, try The Regent you will be pleasantly surprised and if you book along with your Singapore Airways flight it is excellent value of aroun £75/pmt

Reviews.Title: “Grand in every sense of the word!”
Reviews.Author: BiggieShorty
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 kids aged 14 and 17 stayed at The Regent for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. All personell is ever so helpful and friendly. During our last night I got quite sick and the manager on duty arranged for a late check out so I had time to recuperate. But even with the late check out we still needed to wait a couple of hours before we could head to the airport so we went to the pool where the poolboy built me a very comfortable bed to lie on. Next time I will definitely stay at The Regent again: location is quite but within 5 minutes you're in ever bustling Orchard Road, people at reception and the pool couldn't be more helpful, attentive and friendly, the room was very tastefully decorated and a good size and the atrium is beautiful. Shop around on the internet for bargains, we booked through alpharooms.com and paid less than I would have for a 3 star hotel through expedia or hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “The Regent--a wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bewarm
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 2 different times and areplanning to stay thereagain in January of 08. The rooms are lovely, the staff friendly and cooperative (they know your name every time that you return) and it is conveniently located. It is a Four Seasons quality hotel without the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Relaxatin”
Reviews.Author: Inga_MK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regent for 5 nights in mid July. The guest rooms were spacious. My room was off one of the side corridors from the Atrium, and was very quiet (apart from my neighbours having a shower at 1am!). The breakfast buffet is amazing - everything from English fried breakfast to porridge, pastries, cold meats, pancakes, japanese miso soup, rice & pickes, local delicacies and even just cereal if that's what you want. The staff are all very polite and courteous and nothing is a problem for them to sort out. There is a wireless network which works throughout the hotel. The Bar is great, and served better Singapore Slings than Raffles. Also has a huge selection of Whisky. Location is brilliant - close to Tanglin Mall, and Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ttraveler401
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Regent for four nights while on U.S. government business and was given a corporate rate below my maximum per diem by calling the Regent Hotels toll-free reservations number. Bottom line: it was an excellent choice. The rooms and beds were large and quiet. The opulent lobby opens to four glass elevators that run up the center of the atrium to the top floor. The location was good: about a five minute walk to Orchard Road and about 10 minutes to the Botanical Gardens, which are beautiful. (The Orchid Gardens are a must-see.) A few Singapore notes: - Don't bother renting a car. Taxis are dirt cheap, with a ride from one side of the island to the other being less than $10 U.S. The subways are also incredibly clean and well-marked. - the national language for business is English and all signs are in English. - Singapore is probably the safest metropolitan area that you will visit in your lifetime, day or night. - the only negative experience: getting a Singapore Sling at Raffles is a waste of money and time. At more than $30 U.S. for a single drink, there are much better ways to spend your money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Good”
Reviews.Author: Member403604
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May 2007. As many reviewers have said, the Regent is a Four Seasons hotel, and it is possibly the best five star hotel I've stayed in. This is all the more amazing when a quick web search finds a price that would usually stretch to only three stars. Staff were genuinely friendly and very efficient - the doorman asked my name as I got out of the limo, and he then took me to the front desk and introduced me to the clerk, who quickly processed everything and then showed me personally to and around the room. My bags arrived shortly afterwards, and again the bellboy was genuinely keen to make sure that I could see where everything was and that I had all I needed. All staff then greeted me by name throughout my stay. (How did they know?) Quality of the room was exceptionally high and the bed extremely comfortable. It's probably ten minutes' walk from Orchard Rd proper, which you should bear in mind if you want to make use of Singapore's amazing Metro system, although there may well be buses passing by. But the short distance translates into a much quieter and restful location. Didn't make use of any facilities - bar the breakfast - as my stay in Singapore was so short. Breakfast was marred for me by a very loud tape of awful saxophone 'easy listening' music, but that's my only complaint. The hotel lobby reaches to the top floor - twelve storeys. My room was on the top floor and the walk across the bridge from the lifts was vertigo-inducing the first couple of times I crossed it. However, the first time, the front desk clerk immediately offered me a room on the lower floor. If you feel this might be a problem for you, you should request a room on a lower floor. Lastly the Ziggurat design of the hotel means that the bigger rooms have a large terrace. So that might be a reason to upgrade, though I didn't see those rooms. Overall, a really exceptional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterTravels
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Regent. The room / bathroom itself was fine, no complaints. The bed was comfortable and room was good size. Servce at the hotel was outstanding. No matter were you were, it seemed that someone was always there asking you if you needed help with something and always with a smile. The business center was great, although internet was expensive. The same goes for the buffet restuarant. The food and service were great, just expensive. The breakfast buffet was also great. The location was great too, especially for shoppers. One could easily make a short walk to the main shopping drag. For other locations, taking a taxi or the subway is simple. I stayed for 3 nights and went on several Singapore city tours with Tour East.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: TXExpat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regent Singapore for one night during a recent business trip. From the time I checked in to the time I checked out, the service was impeccable. The rooms were very nicely furnished and very clean. But to me, what sets a nice four star hotel apart from a great five star hotel is the service, and it's quite good at the Regent. I would highly recommend this hotel; it's first-rate.

Reviews.Title: “good experience, above average gym”
Reviews.Author: vaxx
Reviews.Content: service is really great, as other people have mentioned there is a real warmth and friendliness from all the staff. i had a few problems with my door key and there was always someone to come up and sort it out. only other downside is that there is no toothbrush/toothpaste provided in bathroom. the pool is small, and i mean its not big enough to even do a lap. the surroundings at the pool area are also a bit bland - its stuck in an awkward gap between two buildings with a third looking down opposite. however the service at poolside is wonderful, towels and iced water are provided complimentarily. the gym is accessible 24 hours with your room key. there are about 8 running machines/exercise bikes, plus shoulder press, lateral pull down and chest press machines, a smith machine and an abs sit up bench. Theres a rack of free weights with the heaviest being aroun 55 pounds. the gym is surprisingly well used. both times i was there, there were at least 5 other people exercising so it can get a bit cramped. it is located indoors with no windows so feels a bit like exercising in a box however ventilation is good. theres a nice little area to sit down and recover or wait for friends and you can help yourself to fruit, tea and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stop-over.”
Reviews.Author: Speges
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here on our way to Australia. It's in a quiet location near the Botanical Gardens It's well worth walking around the gardens as they are very peaceful and beautifully laid out. It's very cheap to hire a cab to go into the centre and we also used public transport. The hotel is very clean and the staff are excellent. We ate in the hotel's main restaurant twice and the food was very good. It feels a very safe city and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore !”
Reviews.Author: chiliyo
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Singapore ! Within a walking distance of Orchard Road. Charlene was the best hostess at any hotel I've stayed in Asia. She always had my favourite Tom Collins ready when she saw me coming into the lounge. Singapore is a great place to visit ! I cannot fault this hotel on anything. I would recommend it to anybody going to Singapore... very affordable prices too.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons service at Holiday Inn prices”
Reviews.Author: 6andy6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Four Seasons Hotel group...a 4 star (possible 5) brand. But the service does not show it. Everyone, and I mean everyone greats you from the doormen opening the doors to the cleaners to any staff member walking in the hotel. Stayed 9th-11th january in a suite which was booked via hte hotels website. Excellent rate including access to the Club Lounge for stays of 2 days or more (about SIN$300 per night incl breakfast and late check out till 6pm for a suite). Room was not available straight away (arrived early morning) so were escorted to Club Lounge and had breaksfast and a drink. Room was ready within 30 mins and was escorted there. Room consists of small lobby at door, powder room off, lounge room with small tv (tv was a little old fashioned) and mini bar, doouble doors to bedroom, another tv, avaerga esized bathroom, walk in wardrobe, balconys off both rooms (but each separate and not able to walk from one to another). Furniture was more traditional, but in fairly good condition. Could do with some updating. Rooms around an atrium. Lobby nice and green with small ponds aorund glass lifts and bars and cafes. It is a short walk to a little shopping mall out back with a range of shops and a supermarket. Next door is the Traders Hotel. A short walk (no more than 5 mins) down a residential street brings you to Orchard rd. I like this hotel, its situation away from Orchard rd gives it a bit of quietness. Club Liounge served a small but good buffet breakfast with a chef to cook eggs, tea/coffees/soft drinks available all day with biscuits/cookies and alcohol/cocktails in the evneing with a substantial buffet of canapes/finger food. Lounge staff and manager excellent..believe she had been at several Four Seasons over in North/Central Amercia. Although not official a Four Seasons hotel the same level of care and training did show through and I have been at far more expensive hotels that were not as good. Room service was prompt, food hot and well presented on a roll in table and prices were average for a hotel of this level..neither expensive or cheap. Internet access..well that was pricey. Abt Sing$15 per day (compared to Hilton NYC which was $5per day). All in all a hotel I recommend in a heart beat. I can compare this with the Ritz Carlton Singapore and the Intercontinental Singapore and can say it is on the same level as the former and much higher service wise than the latter (which hotel in itself is not bad).

Reviews.Title: “suite dreams at the regent”
Reviews.Author: teddytrails
Reviews.Content: This was the best, from the reception staff greeting us on the steps of the hotel to check in in our suite. The suite deal included full club facilities which included free drinks from 5.30 until 8pm (a great saving in Singapore) plus evening canapes (such a great spread that going out for dinner afterwards seemed a trifle excessive) plus a full breakfast buffet in the club each morning. Our suite was great and we were welcomed with a chinese tea basket and fresh fruit. We even had two bathrooms. Our flight from Singapore was at midnight and checkout was at 1.30pm however, we were able to use the drinks and canapes facility in the club from 5.30 until we left for the airport at 8.00pm. I cannot praise this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmng
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, and I stay in a lot of 5 star hotels. Excellent executive suite, excellent facilities. I especially liked the bar and music. The staff were superb and very attentive. Good location, just a short walk to the central shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “The world's best Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: To enjoy The Regent Singapore, it is best to temper your expectations. Therefore, don't think of this as the second Four Seasons managed hotel in town (The Four Seasons Singapore is a few blocks away, connected to Orchard Road through an air-conditioned passaged linked to the Singapore Hilton. . .), but rather the best Hyatt Regency in the world. If you doubt this, note that this John Portman designed hotel could easily be in downtown Atlanta, with the bubble glass elevators, corkscrew circular staircases, and ivy trellised sun dappled atrium up through the center of this concrete building. Alas, the materials are a bit better than your average garden-variety Hyatt atrium, with glowing brass, fine dark woods, and gleaming marble. Rooms and suites are quite bright, both from floor-to-ceiling windows (sliding glass doors in the suites) and yellow walls (the pink exterior doors are a bit odd for my taste). The hotel is actually is great shape, and looks as if it were renovated recently--upkeep is quite good. That said, there are numerous, surprising disappointments. I was in a one-bedroom suite, with two balconies. . .one each off the living room and the bedroom. Still, there is no patio furniture out there. . .not a chair, table, or even a stool. Bathrooms are nicely fitted with black granite and pleasant amenities, but are small for a hotel with these aspirations. . .exposed toilet, shower and tub combination, single basin, not competitive in this market (by contrast, the bathtubs at the Ritz enjoy skyline views, for example) I would think that a few bottles of water would be standard in a hotel of this caliber, but none to be found. While breakfast food is plentiful and imaginative, Capers--where buffet is served--is a disappointing room and loud! I was scolded by the hostess for arriving 15 minutes before closing--surprising to me that in a Four Seasons Hotel, I should plan to arrive at the hotel's convenience. Location is about four blocks from Orchard Road, within walking distance of the Botanic Garden.. If this were a Hyatt Regency, the experience would be great. This hotel is not. I look forward to quick remedy to these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but may be time for a renovation?”
Reviews.Author: Blankii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Regent for a couple if nights in September last year. This was a convenient place for us to stay as my best friend’s wedding reception was being held in one of their ball rooms. My first impression of the Regent was great – we arrived in Singapore at 6:00 am and they allowed us to check-in and have breakfast that morning! In addition to this, the package I booked via the Regent website included a late check-out, so I paid for two nights, but actually stayed for three full days. Great value! The hotel itself is probably starting to show its age somewhat. The foyer area is still quite attractive, however the rooms are starting to look a little dated, especially given the Regent’s five star status. The hotel is still very well maintained and kept immaculately clean, however I think the rooms could benefit from an update. Having said that, the public areas are extremely well presented, especially the foyer, restaurants, pool area and function rooms. Location-wise, it’s a bit of a hike to get to Orchard Road, especially in the Singaporean heat, however it makes for good exercise and I really can’t complain about the location overall. In summary I’d say that whilst there are some small areas for improvement, overall this is a high quality hotel with excellent service and rooms in need of some updating.

Reviews.Title: “The Regent Singapore: a fallen star”
Reviews.Author: PDowney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Club Room at The Regent Singapore. Check-in was at the front desk whereby when I last stayed at this hotel 10 years ago, check-in was in-room. Another Club guest checking in at the same time was complaining that he was accustomed to check-in at the Club level. I was not accompanied to the room, but was given a note detailing Club benefits. On entering the ice-cold room, I found that the air-conditioning was set at 0 degrees and the windows were covered in condensation. The carpet in the room was well past its use-by date, clearly evidenced by too many shampoo treatments over the years. The room was gloomy, with the exception of one orchid plant working overtime to breathe life into an otherwise soulless room. The soft furnishings were also well worn and the bathroom wasn't much better, with a shower above the bath and a low-cost shower curtain. The hand basin had, at some stage, suffered porcelain damage and had subsequently been repaired in a DIY fashion by the hotel's handyman. The Club's selection of wines was below average and, when I enquired about a sparkling wine for an aperitif, I was told this was not available. The hotel boasts about its recently refurbished Club, however I found the seating worn, crammed and uncomfortable. I was discouraged from venturing onto the deck as it had rained earlier in the day and the staff must have decided it was too much trouble to wipe down the outdoor furniture. I opted to take breakfast in the restaurant, rather than the cramped confines of the Club. I found the buffet breakfast to be mediocre and service lacking. I'm delighted that I was subjected to this hotel for just one night and what a difference 10 years has made from my last most memorable experience of The Regent Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Four Seasons Exec Suite for a one night stopover on our way to Oz. The room was great - lovely bedroom, lounge area, 2 bathrooms, 2 TVs, balcony etc. Fab toiletries too! We upgraded a couple of days before from a standard room to this one for an additional £20 - so it is well worth looking for offers with the hotel directly. Position - not far from the Singapore Airlines bus route which takes you all around Singapore for next to nothing. Too far to walk to the main going out areas, but close to Botanical Gardens which we walked back from. Taxis from the more touristy areas of Singapore to this hotel are really cheap. Service - excellent! From the doorman to the reception staff to the room service guy. This really impressed me, and I'm used to 4 & 5 star international hotels. Room service options were limited late at night, but very tasty! Cleanliness - very good, no complaints here. One tip - ask for a late check-out - our deal included use of the room til 6pm on day of departure if available - very handy for tired travellers. Lobby, bar, lounge areas are all very nice; the only downside to the hotel is that it does look bland when you are on one of the higher floors, but this is really an insignificant point. Taxi from airport to the hotel - about £8.00 / 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Four seasons service for half the price”
Reviews.Author: travelator
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed there for a total of three nights. The hotel is off the top of Orchard road (7 mns walk) which is just as well as it means that the whole area is a lot quieter than some the other hotels. + points Good service Attentive staff Great breakfast Comfortable beds Clean and friendly environment Good jazz trio - Points The Cocktails may have been affordable but they were nonethless average The swimming pool a tad small with little exposure to the sun The Regent is in my opinion a classy place which will make any stay in Singapore enjoyable without breaking the bank. One final word of advice don't go for the deluxe rooms but upgrade to the executive suite which is slightly more expensive but twice as big and comes with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Snob says OH MY GOODNESS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: conedd
Reviews.Content: I simply can not give this hotel the rating it deserves! If you are looking for Four Seasons Service and Rooms... but cannot afford the price.... COME HERE. Singapore Regent is a Four Season's Hotel... But the cost is a little easier to swallow. I stayed at Regents Singapore this weekend... and have a reservation for Four Season's next weekend... Please let them be as Fabulous as Regents Singapore.. Although I did not pay for the service I received... I waaaaaaaaaaaaay more than appreciated it! THANK YOU REGENT!!!!!! Really!!!! YOU ARE QUITE INCREDIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Batlets
Reviews.Content: What a place! what a hotel! Everything from the service of the door staff to the cleaning staff was A1 ! Hubby was on a business trip for 7 days and I managed to persuade him that it would be excellent if I accompanied him! From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, nothing was too much trouble. Our flight had arrived at 6 am so we presumed that we would have to wait until midday to check-in - but no -after a short time sorting out the necessaries (which gave me a chance to admire the breathtaking lobby with its fountains and glass lifts) we were taken to our room which was absolutely beautiful! Stunning marbelled floors/bathroom - huge comfortable bed - large tv - tea/coffee - lovely furniture and the normal mini-bar ( as usual very expensive). I must admit that I was worried about 'being on my own' whilst hubby was at work - but you are as safe on your own in Singapore at 4am (should you want to party till then) as you are at 4pm. All the restaurants were excellent and breakfast featured a good choice of multi-national fayre. One little hiccup was the laundry service - most of my clothes came back 2 sizes too small! (but this might have had something to do with the amount I ate!) other than that everything about the 'Regent' was perfect! Shopping on Orchard Road is only 10 mins walk away or Taxis ( unbelievably cheap!) are readily available. All in all a thouroughly enjoyable stay made all the better by excellent service/food - we can't wait for the next time!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels I have Stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ronfaddison
Reviews.Content: At first sight the hotel was stunning with a towering atrium and lots of tasteful decor but it got better! The standard of the service - from everyone we met - was superb. On arrival I picked up my case and was told jocularly by the bell captain that no-one carried their case in The Regent. After check in the baggage was whisked up to our room almost as quickly as we were. The receptionist accompanied us to the lift, something we seldom, if ever, experience outside Singapore. The room was large and was well appointed although the bathroom was quite small. I really liked the fact that all (or at least most) rooms opened onto balconies overlooking the atrium as I felt that this considerably enhanced security in addition to giving a nice aspect on leaving the room. The Concierge was extremely helpful. The pool was a reasonable size and pleasant. Here also, the standard of service was immaculate. We had room service one night. We were told the food would arrive by a specific time (only a few minutes) and it did. The bar was pleasant although expensive but I am afraid that I did not like the group who were performing. The hotel is about 8-10 minutes walk from the top end of Orchard Road which means fairly easy access to the various facilities there. It is also next door to a reasonable shopping mall with a good supermarket and ATMs. Happy hour is available in nearby bars which helps reduce the ridiculous price of beer in Singapore. My only small criticism was that I found it impossible to get really hot water late in the evening.
